Title: Data Analyst (Remote: Anywhere US)
Description:
With more than ten years as a leader in the veterinary services industry, Vetsource® provides innovative pharmacy, technology, and business services to the pet health industry and strives to be the most trusted advocate in a rapidly evolving world. With Mars Petcare, one of the world’s largest pet care providers, as its lead investor, Vetsource operates with an experienced and passionate management team to help drive the industry forward. Vetsource's solutions include prescription management, data and insights, and client engagement. 
Love pets? Want to make an impact while being a part of a growing organization? Join the Vetsource Business Intelligence Team! In five years, Vetsource has grown by more than 50% and we’re not done yet! Join our team of bright and energetic people who want to help develop and deliver innovative pharmacy, technology, and business services to the pet health industry. 
We welcome all applicants who qualify. While skills and experience matter, we love a good fit too! 
Did you know…
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized groups tend only to apply when they check every box. If you think you might be a good fit for a role but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still reach out. We'd love to learn more about you!
Data Analyst
The Vetsource Data Analyst is responsible for providing other teams at Vetsource internal analytics and plays a key role in helping the organization understand itself. Your focus as a Data Analyst will be in helping the rest of the business to interpret data, measure performance and make Vetsource a more data driven organization. Excellence in this position requires a drive to be as helpful as possible towards your teammates in other parts of the organization, a willingness to understand their needs and rigorous thinking to build sustainable solutions to address them.
Responsibilities:

Dig deep with business partners in order to understand their needs and gather requirements
Synthesize and visualize data clearly while retaining context necessary for decision making 
Develop well thought-out metrics to measure business goals
Build robust automated reporting and processes to minimize repetitive work
Build ML models to clean and augment data
Identify and explore useful data sources to then integrate them into our data warehouse
Model disparate data sources into a common data layer
Evaluate analysts’ models and other output for completeness and relevance
Other duties as assigned

Experience and Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in business intelligence, analytics, statistics or similar
Proficient in any variety of SQL
BA in engineering, economics, math or similar qualification
Experience building dashboards with Tableau, PowerBI, Looker or similar
Experience with Agile, Kanban, Scrum or similar 
Proficient with Python or R
Familiarity with DBT or other data modeling software
Background in operations, finance, marketing, sales, veterinary medicine or other business areas is a plus.

ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENT
Vetsource employees are expected to support and model Vetsource’s Core Value Principles: Do the right thing every time; Treat others the way they want to be treated; Embrace Change; Be innovative; Get it done, and Enjoy the work! Employees will be held accountable for knowledge and the practical application of these principles.
At Vetsource, we know that we do our best work when we have an inclusive and diverse team, where we can draw on our different life experiences to help us deliver innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate the differences that make us each unique just as much as we are driven by the things we have in common, and we work to create a supportive, inclusive, and welcoming environment in which all people can thrive.
Vetsource Total Rewards:

Competitive pay and benefits including medical, dental, life, and disability insurance 
Flexible scheduling, including remote work where possible 
Professional development opportunities 

#LI-Remote | #LI-JG1
Vetsource is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity, equity, and an inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Title: BI & Data Analyst
Description:
Why join us? 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 We are looking for a highly motivated BI & Data Analyst to join the Financial Systems Team in Toronto. This role will report to the Manager, Financial Systems and be responsible for designing and validating management system reports (including Power BI, Power Query and Excel), performing data analysis using a wide variety of applications, and driving automation efforts within the Finance team (specifically focused on Robotic Process Automation). To succeed in this role, candidates will have a strong aptitude towards working with large volumes of data, experience in data analytics, ability to mine data, and understanding data flow & structure. This role requires strong attention to detail as well as the ability to multitask in a complex environment. The preferred candidate will have a strong focus on customer service and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups, financial team and IT department. 

 As a member of this team, you will be responsible for 
Work with financial and operational data from primary or secondary data sources 
Seek efficiencies in existing processes and execution of process improvement initiatives, including exploring and identifying potential new tools and technologies for enhancing reporting automation capabilities, including the use of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) 
Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in complex data sets 
Exploring large data sets and drawing meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs 
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues and follow data governance policies 
Work with management teams to prioritize business, analytics and information needs and understand project requirements 
Assist with the preparation and development of reporting, presentations and various materials for discussion at the executive level 
To succeed in this role, you have 
Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. 
Have a minimum of 1-2 years of demonstrated experience in a similar role (e.g. Data Analyst or BI Data Analyst). 
Willingness to learn RPA and automated technologies, with a strong inclination to improve processes and not settle for ‘status quo’ (exposure to UI Path an asset). 
Advanced Excel knowledge (including Pivot Tables, Power Query, VBA Macros), and proficient in Power BI, and SQL. 
Experience and exposure to Hyperion Financial Management, Global Spreadsheet Server, and other BI Tools (e.g. Tableau) an asset. 
Strong eagerness to learn new tools, topics and explore opportunities to leverage technology to generate efficiencies and improve capabilities. 
Team oriented individual with strong communication skills, who is comfortable engaging with different groups within the organization (including non-technical audiences). 
Technical expertise in data mining and analysis, with an understanding of financial reporting concepts. 
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and innovative approaches for resolution. 
Strong project management and organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and manage high priority projects with multiple or competing deadlines. 


Our story:
 Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees. 

 For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Production Operations Analyst, Planning
Description:
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada (TMMC) is a world-class automotive facility with manufacturing plants located in Cambridge and Woodstock, Ontario. Our plants currently manufacture the best-selling Toyota RAV4, RAV4 Hybrid, the Lexus RX 350 and RX 450h vehicles and the popular Lexus NX and Lexus NX Hybrid models. Recognized year after year on the global stage for manufacturing quality by our customers, we are also recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers.
The world-famous Toyota Production System, a philosophy of continuous improvement and on-going training, enables each Team Member to work towards their highest potential. The success of our company stems from hiring results-driven, self-motivated individuals, with the ability to work together to achieve team goals.
What We Offer 

Competitive compensation package includes overtime pay, annual bonus, flexible benefits program and defined contribution pension plan
19 Paid Days off during the year in which their first anniversary falls, plus 5 Floating Holidays that generally fall between Christmas and New Year
Family is important - maternity and parental leave program has Employment Insurance (EI) top-up 5
Career support through reimbursement for professional development and tuition fees
Vitality Wellness App that encourages and rewards you for leading a healthier lifestyle
Company Diversity and Inclusion business partnering groups
Employee & Family Vehicle Discounts
Build friendly and long-lasting relationships through social events and an on-site fitness facility

Role Overview
The Production Operations Analyst, Planning position provides a Team Member with the opportunity to build a solid foundation in the Toyota Production System (TPS) and “Just-In-Time” principles. Team Members will be exposed to Toyota’s world class production facility with a focus on vehicle throughput management across the Weld, Paint and Assembly shops. Direct interaction with the production shop-floor will strengthen our Team Member’s operational skill-set while project assignments will allow our Team Members to develop strong leadership, project management and presentation skills. Team Members can continue to shape their career development aspirations within the Production Control Silo by building upon the technical strengths developed in the Control Room and apply them towards other areas of the supply chain.
To learn more about our Production Control/Supply Chain department click here to check out https://tmmc.ca/en/production-control-individual-job/.
What you’ll be doing 
Daily Management (70%): In-house Operations

Conduct plant wide monitoring (Central Hub) of the Lexus RX, Rav4 and Rav4 Hybrid production lines with real-time analysis of internal plant inventory levels between shops (Weld / Paint / Assembly) and down-time condition impact
Make Production line stop/start recommendations with timely and accurate company-wide communication (production down-time escalation) and condition reporting
Process Vehicle Orders; monthly, weekly and daily vehicle order acceptance into Toyota’s production control build sequencing system including change management analysis and vehicle progression tracking

External Operations (Sequence Suppliers):

Direct support of component parts sequencing with multiple near-site (local) suppliers including system set-up, data transmission, change management, and on-time delivery confirmation

Projects (30%): 

Support projects such as Model Year changes and yearly Shut-down planning
Lead self-driven activities and tasks that support data analytics to advance Toyota’s business condition

Desired Skills and Experiences 

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Engineering, Science or other equivalent degree
Minimum of 1 to 3 years of relevant experience
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and knowledge of database interaction; ability to write SQL queries
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and evaluate results; proven aptitude for working with numbers
Strong problem-solving skills to identify and interpret complex issues and implement sustainable solutions
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and multi-task
Excellent verbal and communication skills
Strong interpersonal and team building skills; ability to work in a team, across multiple sections, departments and companies while considering various levels of management and stakeholders
Flexible to support rotating shifts (bi-weekly)
Willing to support daily and weekend overtime requirements as needed
Possible travel within North America, as well as Overseas (less than 10% per year)
Must be flexible to work in Cambridge and/or Woodstock plant locations
All internal applications must be submitted through tm.tmmc.ca
For more information about the Production Control Department, in a new browser window copy and paste this link https://tmmc.ca/en/production-control-individual-job/

To promote a comfortable, safe and productive work environment, as well as to comply with all federal, provincial and/or local laws, TMMC is a smoke-free property.
TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse team. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. TMMC is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.
Job Type: Full-time

Bonus pay
Overtime pay

Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site gym

Paid time off
Store discount
Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Description
Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering your assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo.
Charger logistics invests time and support into its employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. We are entrepreneurial-minded organization that welcomes and support individual idea and strategies. We are currently expanding and looking to add a motivated individual to our team based out of our Brampton office. The Pricing Analyst will maintain and grow all modes of business by supporting the Pricing and Reporting, Sales and operations department in providing analytical insight to pricing strategies on services being offered by the company. The Pricing Analyst also plays a critical role in ensuring the client always receives an accurate and current price.
Responsibilities-: 

Perform detailed costing analysis and develop pricing options to present to Sales team for customer negotiations; use different pricing scenarios to rate shipments and compare net results
Assist in planning, developing, and evaluating pricing strategies at a macro and micro level in line with business strategy. Analyze factors such as volume opportunity, profit potential, and service cross-over to other departments, etc. that impacts pricing decisions.
Review performance data that includes financial, sales, and activity reports to monitor and measure the productivity, goal achievement, and overall effectiveness.
Supportive of the Business Development and Customer Service departments to identify and target new growth opportunities as well as expand existing business with current clientele.
Identifying target markets and tracking market trends based on the company’s current proficiency and competitiveness in response to clearly identifiable advantageous positions
Responsible for the ongoing improvement of pricing processes
Respond to pricing inquiries, investigate and resolve pricing issues.

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree Business, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics and Analytics is preferred
Ability to understand the business processing requirements using technology and conceptualize creative solutions to implement them.
Previous experience in an analyst role and or in pricing function is required
Proficiency in Microsoft office is a must
Experience performing data extraction utilizing tools.
Must be able to work to deadlines and sustain high productivity levels

Benefits

Competitive Pay
Healthcare Benefit Package
Career Growth

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
You found us. Awesome. Something led you here, maybe a glimpse of potential and something amazing? Well that’s how we feel about Klue.
 


 Everyone has competitors, yet few know them well. Cue Klue. We are a team relentlessly focused on creating industry leading software to enable every department of every business to leverage the best of the web’s knowledge and the collective insights of their own people.
 


 We are a high-growth company with:
 

An experienced leadership team at the helm
Risk-takers and builders who own it and get IT done
Combined group, who love the fact that not everything is defined, so we can innovate, create, ignite



 Joining Klue, you’ll have the opportunity to own your zone, experiment and find what works. Then execute with the support of a team propelling you forward. We’re all creating this industry leading product. It's an experience that will no doubt change your career forever.
 


 We’re growing and currently looking to add a Data Analyst Intern to our team. This internship will span several functions of the Insights department and will give you a broad view of what it takes to run an innovative SaaS company. Klue is a very collaborative company where we believe in the value that can be unlocked by sharing data insights across departments and clients - you'll be getting a full picture of how a SaaS company on a rocketship trajectory operates. You’ll have many opportunities to listen in on strategic conversations and will be encouraged to ask questions along the way. As the company grows, we will have many roles to fill within the Insights department and would hope the right candidate would consider returning one day.
 


 As a data analyst intern, you will be focused on helping our insights team ensure our data providers and outsourced content creators are delivering accurate data to their end-users.
 


 The Insights' team scope covers data validation for existing sources, outsourced content, and new potential data sources. As the data marketplace is always evolving, you will also be involved in broader projects across the team.
 
 This is You:

 Highly analytical and critical thinker
 Ability to digest and communicate complex data
 You like ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced environments
 You have experience with Excel and/or Python
 You like to learn new things and are keen to become an expert

 Bonus points for...

 Experience with analytics platforms, data cleaning initiatives, data gathering.

 What you'll be measured on:

 Ability to identify trends in data sets and develop unique solutions.
 Efficiency in data gathering and data cleaning.


   If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.
  




  We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off.
 


 As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.
 


 All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.
 


 We’re excited to meet you and in the meantime, get to know us:
 

   ED&I Initiatives & Commitments - Pay Up For Progress & 50 - 30 Challenge & Klue Blog
 

   ️ Series A (2020)
 

   Series B (2021)
 

   Culture, culture, culture! 
 

  Glassdoor
 

   About Us
 

   Twitter
 

   Instagram
 

️ LinkedIn


   Angel.co

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) (m/f/d) * 



Primary Objectives:
 The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) is responsible for fulfilling all data processing and reporting needs for the Inspections department. The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) will conduct qualitative and quantitative data analysis, data assessments and report generation for the department, while working collaboratively with Area Managers assisting them with special projects and any ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned. The incumbent will work closely with the Inspections team to generate contract documents such as invoices, summary reports for internal and external use and general management of all Inspections data. This role is ideal for an independent thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, timeliness and professionalism.
 This position is based out of Head Office, Toronto.
 Responsibilities:

Analyse all inspection data for accuracy, invoicing and reporting purposes.
Know how to manipulate Excel files and to use it in conjunction with other programs.
Compile data, verify accuracy and sort information to prepare for data entry.
Assist in other data sorting and data cleansing initiatives within the department.
Design and apply unified reporting and tracking standards to easily report and track KPIs in the department.
Work within existing BI frameworks and build data models to support analysis and reporting.
Ability to performing data visualization as required.
May, at times, work with peers across the organization and may also be involved in non-inspection related projects/requests.
Other work as assigned.



WE OFFER 
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on emerging trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the future of insurance and risk solutions, for a modern world.
 At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way we live and work.
 HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit www.hsb.ca.


WE EXPECT 
Qualifications:

1-3 years’ experience working with medium to large size data sets and general data management.
College Diploma or University Degree in a related field.
Advanced capabilities in computer application software, knowledge of data bases and analytics tools.
Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Excel functions (complex formulas, macros, pivot tables) is a strong asset.
Has a keen eye for this discipline and an analytical mind, is able to effectively interpret a variety of data/metrics and contextualize it in a business environment.
Must possess strong technical skills in applications such as: Excel, SQL, R, DAX, VBA, ETL, PowerBI, etc.
Excellent data entry skills with high attention to detail.
Strong communication skills (emails and phone).
Superior organizational skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, while maintaining efficiency and accuracy.







Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to us. We strive for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace based on principles which align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. Candidates requiring accommodation during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; we will strive to work with individuals to find a suitable means to meet their needs.
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Opening up a world of opportunity.


We're a financial services organization serving more than 40 million customers across the globe through our Wealth & Personal Banking, Commercial Banking and Global Banking & Markets businesses.
We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up a world of new opportunities for our customers, our people and our communities.


HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking. 
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.


About Asset Management
HSBC Asset Management, is the asset management division of the HSBC Group. HSBC Asset Management develops and manages investment management products and services for clients around the world, from individual retail customers to major multinational corporate clients, sovereign wealth funds and financial institution clients.


Our vision is to be the leading asset manager for HSBC clients with a clear long-term commitment to be focusing on understanding and meeting the needs of the personal, commercial, corporate and institutional clients of HSBC's global businesses.


About the role:
Data and Analytics Professionals at HSBC have responsibility for executing our HSBC Data Strategy. Their responsibilities are threefold:

Recognising data as an asset to HSBC by managing Data Risk and ensuring we are compliant with our Data standards and policies;
Using analytics and data science to unlock the value of our data; and
Implementing and maintaining our Data Technologies.

Data and Analytics Professionals are geographically dispersed and aligned to the Global Businesses / Global Functions or regions.


Responsibilities:

Manage and deliver Data Management services to the Global Business of Asset Management and local business in Canada (“the business”)
Manage and support the business with technical capabilities to analyze, edit and report on the management of data
Manage and support master and meta-data used by the business to ensure that data is used consistently
Support the business in the design and delivery of technical solutions compliant with data management requirements
Good team player and capable of working with global and local functional team members in different time zones
Establish and maintain good working relationships with other business units and teams locally and globally
Good knowledge of data analytics, data visualization and good data literacy



  Requirements 
 


Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience managing data in investment management or other related industries.
Undergraduate degree in finance, statistics, computing science or other related qualitative disciplines.
Completion of CSC or other equivalent courses on investment industry.
Good team player who can work with global and local functional team members in different time zones and who can foster and maintaining good relationships.
Detail oriented and able to prioritise multiple projects and/or tasks.
Good analytical skills with advanced MS suite and SQL. Data analytics, data visualization or other equivalent training would be beneficial



HSBC Proud
HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment.
We encourage all Black people, Indigenous People of Canada and people with disabilities to self-identify in their applications. Please contact our Canada Careers mailbox (careers@hsbc.ca) with any additional inquiries or for support and reasonable accommodations during the selection process.
If this is not the ideal role for you, we invite you to sign up here to our Talent Community so we can update you about job opportunities and career events in your area of interest. We are always looking for people with purpose and ambition who can help build the bank for the future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Facility Location- Toronto
 Work Location -
 Posting Locations - Toronto (GTA)
 Department - Anaplan Solutions
 Job Function - Finance and Accounting
 Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried
 Shift/Hours –



 About Us


 Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!
 Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

 We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love. We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

 Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.




 About This Opportunity


 We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our Finance team. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop your skills within the Anaplan ERP system and work toward becoming an Anaplan Certified Model Builder! Our aim to is give you hands on Anaplan implementation experience in developing, Planning, Budgeting and Forecasting solutions. Experienced Anaplan Model Builders are also very welcomed to apply!

 Some of the experience we are looking for:
     

Proficiency in designing and maintaining data hub mapping and conversions, system configuration and integration, calculations, models build, reporting
Modify existing models as part of a connected solution, optimization or to incorporate new functionality.






 Responsibilities




 Collect business requirements and current-state process mapping required to build a user story associated with a new or enhanced capability
Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document)
Translate business requirements in the form of excel models and/or user stories into efficient and scalable high-functioning Anaplan models.
Support the creation of test scripts and lead the User Acceptance Testing process.
Troubleshoot model bugs, and continuously enhance and support existing models.
Optimize calculation models and business logic.






 Qualifications



1- 3 years in data analysis and model building
Anaplan L2 L3 Model Builder Certification (L3 is a plus) is nice to have but not mandatory however, willingness to learn and achieve certification is required
Strong knowledge around financial systems and processes
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to develop and communicate new ideas and conceptualize innovative approaches and solutions
Knowledgeable of full range of solution catalog
Knowledge in supporting operational stability through various life cycle phases (planning, implementation, steady state)





 Important


 All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. Title: Data & System Analyst, Bus Safety
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our Bus Operations Office is seeking a Data & System Analyst on a minimum of 12-month contract to coordinate the planning and analytical functions as well as assist in the overall recommendations and directions to improve the safety performance of the Bus Operations Group. 
What will I be doing? 

Identification of repetitive data trends and bringing forward proposals to improve areas. 
Support in the development of the monthly and annual KPI’s and provide progress reports. 
Tracking Customer Complaints based on service changes and driver performance behavior, identifying trends and possible mitigations to improve customer satisfaction 
Based on trends in data, providing supporting information and evidence to the Safety & Training Department to help reduce common accidents and trends. 
Review CVOR score and identify accident trends and violations. Provide corrective actions based on trends and perform regular follow-ups to ensure actions are being achieved and appropriate mitigations were proposed. 
Participating in Incident/accident Investigation and providing recommendations to prevent future occurrences. 
Conducting and/or directing various data analysis and cost/benefit studies of Bus Operations, including interpreting results and outlining trends, as well as developing and recommending alternatives to improve deficiencies and enhance operational efficiencies. 
Developing, documenting, recommending, implementing, monitoring and evaluating new and/or revised operating and administrative rules, standards and procedures for the department; ensuring that such rules and procedures do not negatively impact safety. 
Preparing and monitoring performance measures for various aspects of the business to ensure safety, efficiency and quality of services provided. 
Regular contact with all levels of employees and management staff to provide information, support and recommendations regarding operational and administrative issues, rules, procedures, standards, budgets, etc. 
Delegate tasks and responsibilities to stakeholders to provide directional guidance and actively leads and participates in various meetings, and represents Metrolinx at committees, presentations. 
Interfaces with external public agencies, associations and affiliated groups, to stay apprised of industry trends, regulations, and technologies. 
Coordinates with the Safety Department to ensure the KPI’s are aligned with Corporate Goals and brings forward solutions to negative trends. 
Investigates all new CVOR points identified on the CVOR Record on a monthly basis. 
Coordinates with a variety of internal stakeholders and software developers to establish objectives and performance indicators and develop safety goals, objectives, CVOR safety initiatives, action plans, and archiving needs. 
Work closely with the Safety Department to ensure alignment in all safe practices are adhered and also create recommendations in areas that may require improvements related to safety performance. 
Investigates or provides close-out of investigations performed by external contractors, coordination or facilitates higher level investigations. 
Maintaining quality control and engaging in the continuous improvement of service quality and standard operating procedures. 
Develops and tracks monthly and yearly KPI’s bringing attention to areas that need immediate corrective actions and works with team members to implement and manage actions. 
Manages the oversight of all Bus Operations KPI’s directly related to driver, supervisors, CVOR and Safety related stats, amongst others. 
Performs audits against KPI’s and attends actual visits to locations that have been identified as high risk areas to ensure compliance of safety procedures and assists with the implementation of recommended changes. 
Presents completed KPI reports to various levels of Staffs and serves as the subject matter expert relating to various trends in injuries, collisions, CVOR direction, and provided remedial actions based on findings. 
Provides feedback of findings to Mangers with recommendations to address driving performance issues. 
Implement initiatives to drive operational efficiency and reduce costs.

Title: Data Analyst - Fall 2022 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































 Job Title




































 Data Analyst - Fall 2022 Student - Personal & Commercial Banking
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Data Analyst Co-op will work closely with the Corporate Client Group (CCG) National Operation’s Data Analytics team to support the business with the management of data, reporting and process improvement initiatives. The incumbent should possess data and management information related knowledge and should be familiar with MS Excel and Access. Strong problem solving, time management and attention to details will help ensure success in this role. RBC CCG National Operations supports CCG’s planning, directing, and overseeing their operational policies, rules, initiatives, and goals. The CCG team is responsible for meeting annually established targets for revenues and returns, providing advice to our partners along with broader RBC relationship goals, while the National Operations team helps & supports the group execute long-term and short-term plans

 What will you do?

Support the implementation of robust database and reporting systems for the CCG team and senior management 
Fulfill ad-hoc and periodic data requests based on business requirements 
Analyze data for useful insights and build meaningful dashboards & data visualizations
Automate reporting processes to help the team save resources 
Perform data mining, cleanup and investigate discrepancies to enhance data quality
Support database administration activities and troubleshoot user inquiries

 Document and diagram key system and data management processes

 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

3rd or 4th year student with a minimum of one Co-Op placement of relatable experience
Working towards undergraduate degree in Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science or Engineering
Intermediate level of MS Office with a focus on Excel and strong familiarity with Access 
Related knowledge and experience in database and data management principals
Ability to perform well under pressure, meet time sensitive deadlines, and prioritize work
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Team player and also able to work independently •Strong oral and written communication skills
Proven capabilities in effective management of tasks and delivering high quality work 

Nice-to-have

VBA
Tableau
Python


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference.
Opportunities to build close relationships.







































 Job Summary











































































 Address:




































 VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Canada

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Company: The Boiler Inspection and Insurance Company of Canada
Description:
Driven by technology and fueled by innovation, HSB is Canada’s premier specialty insurance and applied 
technology services provider. Offering 150 years of technical and service excellence, we are focusing on emerging 
trends and unlocking new opportunities for clients. Today, we are accelerating, changing the future of insurance 
and risk solutions, for a modern world. 

At HSB, we value the strengths and contributions of our diverse workforce. We offer continuous learning 
opportunities, giving you flexibility to grow in your career while enjoying a healthy work-life balance and a 
collaborative approach in our coast-to-coast network of offices. Become part of a rewarding and impactful 
workplace experience while seeing first-hand technologies and risk solutions that are changing the way we live and 
work. 

HSB is much more! It’s insurance. Engineering. Technology. To learn more about us, please visit www.hsb.ca. 

Primary Objectives: 

The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) is responsible for fulfilling all data processing and reporting needs 
for the Inspections department. The Junior Data Analyst (Inspections Department) will conduct qualitative and 
quantitative data analysis, data assessments and report generation for the department, while working collaboratively 
with Area Managers assisting them with special projects and any ad-hoc responsibilities as assigned. The incumbent 
will work closely with the Inspections team to generate contract documents such as invoices, summary reports for 
internal and external use and general management of all Inspections data. This role is ideal for an independent 
thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, 
timeliness and professionalism. 

This position is based out of Head Office, Toronto. 

Responsibilities: 

Analyse all inspection data for accuracy, invoicing and reporting purposes. 


Know how to manipulate Excel files and to use it in conjunction with other programs. 


Compile data, verify accuracy and sort information to prepare for data entry. 


Assist in other data sorting and data cleansing initiatives within the department. 


Design and apply unified reporting and tracking standards to easily report and track KPIs in the department. 


Work within existing BI frameworks and build data models to support analysis and reporting. 


Ability to performing data visualization as required. 


May, at times, work with peers across the organization and may also be involved in non-inspection related 

projects/requests. 

Other work as assigned. 


Qualifications: 

1-3 years’ experience working with medium to large size data sets and general data management. 






College Diploma or University Degree in a related field. 


Advanced capabilities in computer application software, knowledge of data bases and analytics tools. 


Intermediate to advanced level proficiency with Excel functions (complex formulas, macros, pivot tables) is a 

strong asset. 

Has a keen eye for this discipline and an analytical mind, is able to effectively interpret a variety of 

data/metrics and contextualize it in a business environment. 

Must possess strong technical skills in applications such as: Excel, SQL, R, DAX, VBA, ETL, Power BI, etc. 


Excellent data entry skills with high attention to detail. 


Strong communication skills (emails and phone). 


Superior organizational skills. 


Ability to work independently and as part of a team, while maintaining efficiency and accuracy. 


Creating and maintaining a work environment that promotes respect, diversity and dignity is important to us. We strive 
for equality in our workplace, to eliminate employment barriers, and promote a workplace based on principles which 
align with our company values and promote positive employee practices. Candidates requiring accommodation 
during any stage of our selection process should advise us of this; we will strive to work with individuals to find a 
suitable means to meet their needs. 

If you are interested in applying for this position, please quote Job Reference JDA0622-BW and please click the link: 
Apply here 

We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Jr. Developer/Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview: Ontario One Call acts as the communications link between buried infrastructure owners (our members) and individuals who are planning to dig in the province of Ontario. In 2012, the Ontario Underground Infrastructure Notification System Act (OUINSA) was passed, which stipulates that by law, anyone in the province of Ontario must contact Ontario One Call before they dig.Ontario One Call is charged with the responsibilities of the OUINSA, which involves the operation of a contact centre to receive and process excavation requests, compliance activities to ensure that members meet their legal responsibilities and public education around the need for safe excavation.
*Core Values: *
At Ontario One Call, we are Reliable Experts who Care:

Reliable…We are dependable and accessible
Experts…We have the mindset to lead innovation
Caring…We ensure the safety and well-being in our communities.

Do you have what it takes to join our team?
Position overview: **Ontario One Call employees enjoy a hybrid work model with both work in the office and work from home available. This role is based in Guelph, Ontario and candidates must be willing and able to work in office as required including working primarily on site during their probationary period.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst should possess an understanding and background in reporting and analytics. Reporting to the I.T. Manager, the Jr Developer/Data Analyst will assist the I.T. Manager in maintaining all reporting and analytic and operations projects.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, building and deploying reporting and analysis.
Primary Responsibilities: **

Design and maintaining systems and databases for reporting purpose; this includes fixing coding errors, running job tools and other data-related tasks.
Creating appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the process if necessary
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop new datasets and data driven solutions
Generate reports and analysis
Maintain a repository of reports
Document processes/procedures
Travel as required

Qualifications: **

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluent in reading, writing and verbally communicating in English
Strong technical documentation skills
Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs
Software Programming


C#
.Net
XML
HTML
JavaScript
Python


Strong database and SQL skillset


MySQL / Maria DB
PostgreSQL
Microsoft SQL


Familiarity of data management, data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts including data modeling and transformations.
Strong Microsoft Excel background
Strong Microsoft Access background
Microsoft Power BI (asset)

**
Education and Experience: 

Completion of post secondary in a relevant field
Minimum 1-3 years in similar role with Data/reporting/analytics

Technical Requirements: Candidates wishing to apply must be able to meet the following technical requirements while we/they are working remotely:

High speed internet connection delivered via Fibre, Cable or DSL
Computer that meets the following specifications:


Windows 10 (all updates applied)
Minimum Intel i3
Minimum 4GB RAM
Minimum 512 MB disk space free
Computer connected to internet via Ethernet cable (WIFI connections are NOT supported)
Antivirus software (installed and up to date)
Ability to install Cisco Anyconnect VPN and Avaya Communicator

Candidates must complete and attach a pdf screenshot of a speed test when applying.

Go to: https://ontarioonecall.speedtestcustom.com/


Use password ‘on1call’ to perform a speed test on our custom server


Take a screenshot of the results screen and save it as a pdf file
Attached the file of the screenshot to your application

Rewards: 

Salary of $48,000-$52,000/annum dependent on qualifications and experience
Extensive health, dental and life insurance benefits
Highly engaged workforce and excellent workplace culture
Diverse and inclusive environment
Collaborative team
New, clean and bright facility

Ontario One Call is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.As a precondition to employment, the selected candidate will be required to provide satisfactory employment references, successfully complete a criminal background check prior to or any time following hire, and provide proof of full vaccination for COVID-19.
Don’t forget to include these items in your application: 

Cover letter & Resume
Speed test
Confirm that you meet the technical requirements of working from home

Job Type: Permanent
Salary: $48,000.00-$52,000.00 per year

Title: Data Analyst
Company: The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario
Description:
The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario (CPSO) is seeking a dynamic and professional Data Analyst. This role is ideal for an independent thinker with a problem solving mindset focused on enhancing data management processes with accuracy, efficiency, timeliness and professionalism.
 This position focuses on data systems management, analysis and reporting to identify issues and trends in support of operational improvement of the CPSO.
 Contract Position (18-months)
 Responsibilities
 Data Management, Reporting and Analysis

 Creation of automated operational reports related to key performance indicators and operational benchmarks.
 Building and maintenance of a user-friendly interface for the extraction and querying of operational data
 Develop strategies to generate and automate better reports
 Evaluates and verifies the accuracy, consistency and completeness of the data via a standardized auditing program
 Carries out detailed analysis of College-wide data to evaluate operational performance
 Use operational data to generate ideas related to improving the efficiency of processes
 Presents results of analyses to internal and external stakeholders, such as management, Medical Advisors, Council and Committees
 Respond to ad-hoc data queries from internal and external sources
 Design and develop expansions and modifications to data querying tools developed in Python and SQL, as necessary
 Develops and maintains standard operating procedures and detailed manuals outlining reporting requirements
 Audit the College’s Enterprise System to ensure consistency, accuracy and completeness of data
 Creation and maintenance of Power BI reports for operational data and key performance indicators

 Qualifications

 University degree in engineering, statistics or related field
 Master’s degree considered an asset
 2+ years of relevant work experience
 Knowledge of database management is required
 Proficient computer programming skills in SQL, Python
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and Visio, Power BI, SharePoint
 Demonstrated ability to be self-directed and contribute to a team environment
 Exceptional organizational and time management skills with meticulous attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities, and adherence to deadlines
 Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, with the public and the profession
 Flexibility is necessary as this position is constantly changing and growing
 Equity/diversity/inclusion training would be an asset

 Note: It is a fundamental requirement of employment with CPSO that employees reside in Ontario and can attend the College office as required. Must be able to provide proof of double vaccination.
 Please apply with cover letter and resume by July 13, 2022 at 5:00pm.
 The College is committed to hiring practices that support accessibility for people with disabilities, employment equity and diversity in the workplace. The College actively seeks to increase their diversity by welcoming applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. Applicants with a disability may request accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process by contacting the Human Resources Department.

Title: Entry Level Strategy Analyst Development Program - Toronto - NAELFY23
Description:
We are:
 A Strategy practice shaping the future of business and technology to create the roadmap for our clients. Every day we change the way the world works, for the better. Combining functional and industry expertise with an unrivalled understanding of technology, we use data analytics, human centered design, and digital tools to create business insights and drive change. We call it the Art and Science of Strategy and we are the market leader at this intersection. Visit us here to find out more about Accenture Strategy.

 Become a part of a unique culture that represents a global collective of diverse talent and people innovating together. We are omni-connected, there is no one-size-fits all - some teams are fully remote while others continue to meet with clients.

 You are:
 Given to inquiry, intellectually curious and eager to learn. You use critical and creative thinking along with analytics and data visualization tools to solve problems. You know that companies must navigate complexity with competitive agility. You’ve got the academic preparation, foundational skills, and aspirations to help companies turn disruption into opportunity through strategies that enable them to successfully execute with equal strength across growth, profitability, sustainability, and trust.

 The work:

 Kick-start your career in our Strategy Analyst Development Program to learn the latest strategy skills
 Build your network during office events and volunteer opportunities to gain a sense of inclusion and diversity
 Work closely with clients to analyze how their business is working today and how it could be improved for tomorrow
 Partner with your teammates to show support for their projects and lend your knowledge
 Dig in deep to research, analyze data and come up with great recommendations
 Practice sharing your vision with strong presentations and well-written reports
 Use data visualization skills, charts, graphs and other data models to bring your analysis to life
 Be an ambassador of our worldwide organization that promotes respect for the individual and recruitment of top talent




Here’s what you need:

 Bachelor’s degree – major in any subject that has pushed you to think critically and given you opportunities to solve problems (i.e., business, economics, commerce, computer science, engineering, etc.)
 Minimum overall GPA of 3.3
 Feels comfortable leading workshops, asking others for input and telling stories as a presentation style
 Has experience using data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx) or programming languages (R, Python, Julia, SQL)
 Adept at navigating ambiguity, demonstrated quantitative skills, and thinks analytically
 Understands the implementation of data analytics in solving problems
 Must be in final year of study in September 2022, graduating by August 2023


 How to Apply
 You must submit a cover letter, resume and transcript in order for your application to be considered for an interview. Application deadline is July 8, 2022 at 12:00 PM EST for the Toronto location only.
 Once your application is received, you will be invited to complete our virtual consulting experience through the Discovery Portal. Although this step is not mandatory to complete, we encourage you to try it out.

Title: Application and Data Analyst
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.
           





           The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. 
         










          As an Application and Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the coordination, maintenance, upgrades and life cycling of the technology underpinning the external data access of The City’s data and intellectual property. This is primarily achieved through managing the work section’s digital access portals, including City Online (cityonline.calgary.ca) and Open Data Portal (data.calgary.ca). You will be the liaison between business and internal user needs and technical resources in the IT support groups. This role is the technical subject matter expert for section stewarded system and interfaces with internal City staff to develop solutions related to products offered through the systems. Primary duties include:
         

Coordinate tasks related to managing the technology, software development life cycle and system enhancement initiatives of the section technology architecture.
Document application expectations, current behaviour, defects encountered and design functionality. 
Build test plans to capture new system functionality. Perform testing cycles and document project defects. Review introduced and core functionality, web integrations and regression testing.
Manage system configurations and integrations to allow data access. Use extraction, transformation, and load methodology to transform data for distribution. Develop workflows.
Design and implement technology strategies and controls to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data. Collaborate with data stewards, system stakeholders, business leads and project teams. 
Deliver data-driven analysis of system performance, usage, and data/integration flows. Identify and implement improvements to data access portal processes and software. Conduct structured data analysis, create visualizations, and present data. Incorporate best practices.
Understand reporting requirements, develop and automate reporting.
Research and review technology plans and road maps as related to section technology and evolving standards. Develop implementation plans to address data access challenges and troubleshoot usability of data access portals. Collaborate with team members to identify trends in business, data, and intellectual property.










Qualifications





          A completed 2 year diploma in Computer Science, Business, Science or related field with at least 7 years of related experience in areas such as, but not limited to, software/application development, application support, data management, data manipulation, data structuring or quality assurance/quality control. OR
          


          A degree in Computer Science, Business, Science or related field plus at least 5 years of related experience in areas such as, but not limited to, software/application development, application support, data management, data manipulation, data structuring or quality assurance/quality control.
          


          Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics suite of applications is required, ideally with an in-depth knowledge of Finance and Operations, Commerce, Power BI, Power Automate.
          


          Knowledge of eCommerce solutions and experience in business analysis & market planning.
          


          Knowledge of ETL (Extract Transform Load) technologies for data manipulation and processing.
          


          Strong organizational, interpersonal, communication and project management skills.
          


          A highly motivated self-starter, with a demonstrated ability to work with minimum supervision, and effectively within a team.
          


Pre-employment Requirements 





           Applicants may be tested for appropriate skills.
           


           Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
           
 



















                 Union: CUPE Local 38
                













       Business Unit: Corporate Analytics & Innovation
      

       Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 12 months)
      

       Location: 800 Macleod Trail SE (Hybrid/Remote work possible)
      

       Compensation: Pay Grade 10 $38.14 - 50.98 per hour
      

       Days of Work: This position works a 5 day
      

       work week with 1 day off in a 3 week cycle.
      

       Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week
      

       Audience: Internal/External
      

       Apply By: July 13, 2022
      


       Job ID #: 305922

Title: DATA AND SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description:
About Us

 The Data Collection and Decision Support Solutions Branch with the Community Services I&IT Cluster, partners with ministries and internal/external stakeholders for effective stewardship, use and management of data by providing business consulting and advice, data-collection and decision-support solutions.
  
 It provides design and delivery, and coordinated project management, architecture, quality assurance and data management functions for the entire cluster to ensure solutions meet Ontario Public Service (OPS) quality standards.
  
 The branch fosters an outcomes-based culture for achieving government priorities, balancing the needs of delivering solutions with the imperatives of innovation in policy and program design through evidence-based policy and decision-making.
  

Why work for the Ontario Public Service (OPS)?

 The OPS support career and leadership development, invest in learning opportunities, recognize team and individual achievements, and support flexible work arrangements.
  
 We are re-thinking how we deliver our services. Through various modernization initiatives, we are now accessing and delivering critical services remotely. We are striving to enable a future-ready OPS workforce through enterprise-wide strategies.
  

About the Opportunity

 We are seeking a self-motivated individual for the role of Data and Systems Analyst. The successful candidate for this challenging opportunity will be curious and energetic. They will bring a fresh perspective and provide new insights into how we deliver our analytics initiatives with their data science and data analytics experience. Join our innovative, inclusive and cross-disciplinary team that develops new technology solutions and uses data to its full potential to advance our ministry partner outcomes.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? As a Data and Systems Analyst, you will:
  

develop ministerial insights through reports, dashboards, and analysis on various ministry data assets
analyze ministry data related needs and work with cross-functional teams to provide technical expertise and advice in solutioning complex data analytic applications and advanced analytics solutions
conduct feasibility studies, options analyses, and cost/benefit analyses on advanced analytics systems initiatives
work with a diverse team to contribute to the analysis of business processes and recommend process improvements to effectively and efficiently harness the benefits of digital workflows
prepare project plans with realistic work breakdown structures, estimates of costs, risks, issues, and mitigation strategies 
oversee the testing and implementation of systems initiatives and coordinate the development of all systems documentation
develop strategic and operational frameworks to help ministry partners and internal projects make lasting improvements to their performance and realize outcomes

 How do I qualify?
 Technical Knowledge and Experience: You have:
  

technical knowledge to identify and evaluate information technology options, and to conduct complex systems analysis and design for the development of new systems or systems modifications
experience and knowledge working with data in some or all of these technologies: Excel, SQL, R, Python and/or other scripting languages
experience working with business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Cognos, and/or Tableau
experience of software development lifecycle methodologies and applying them to the development of data analytic products
knowledge of emerging technologies in data analytics to recommend research, evaluation, and data management tools/techniques 
knowledge of data processing/warehousing and statistical analysis techniques
knowledge of theories, practices and techniques of economic, mathematical and statistical theory/analysis, research methods, and procedures to conduct analytical studies and surveys
knowledge of metrics development methodologies for measuring effectiveness and efficiency of solutions 
knowledge of regulatory guidelines, policies, practices and protocols to ensure appropriate reporting and protection of privacy and security of personal information
experience in evaluating and analyzing existing web applications and business intelligence tools for the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) compliance

 Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:

You can assess information technology needs and lead the development of information technology solutions which are cost-effective and improve client program and service delivery.
You can conduct feasibility studies, cost and benefit analyses on complex business and systems initiatives, and recommend systems development solutions.
You have experience conducting data analysis to support research and project teams and prepare data analysis reports.
You can conduct and provide technical expertise in complex systems analysis and design, coordinate development of all systems documentation, and develop and oversee testing and implementation of systems and applications.
You can identify and evaluate sources of data for research purposes, assess and select mathematical/statistical methods, investigate and assess new technologies, and prepare statistical analysis. 
You can synthesize insights from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods.
You can conduct analysis on business/systems initiatives and recommend solutions to meet business
 needs and promote overall ministry IT strategies and objectives.
  
 Communication Skills: You can:
  

discuss client requirements, lead discussions and explain technical issues in clear, non-technical terms
prepare project reports, business cases, systems documentation and manuals
make recommendations to clients and negotiate contracts with vendors
work with users at all levels of familiarity with technology
develop material, including presentations, that are relevant to stakeholders and executives

 OPS Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful, and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions. 
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the application instructions below if you require a disability-related accommodation.
