Title: Data Operation Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity: 

Analyze and investigate our existing vendor and internal data pipelines to identify any discrepancies between implementation and business requirements.
Review the data pipeline code and analyze the data and compare against documentation; for instance, review whether the data appends or overwrite; whether a full snapshot is loaded, or only the delta; review the business transformation logic; review whether all files or a subset from the vendor is being processed; review the JSON parsing logic to see if data attributes are correctly mapped; review attribute names against naming conventions, etc.
Work with Data Leads and Data Engineering to remediate any discrepancies – update requirements, make modifications to the pipeline code, or leave as is.
Manage and enhance investment data infrastructure through initiatives such as improving metadata and data integrity
Stay current with trends in the data and analytics space (e.g. data visualization techniques, Big Data, etc.)

Consider applying if you have most of the following: 

A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or other quantitative discipline.
Minimum of 5 years of direct experience
Familiarity with financial data vendors such as Bloomberg, S&P and Refinitiv and their product offerings
Solid programming skills (ie. Python, pyspark, SQL) with professional programming experience in a data context is a must (e.g. data extraction, data manipulation, data analysis, etc.)
Good understanding of key financial data concepts such as financial statement data, pricing and market data, ESG data and security master data.
Strong analytical skills; detail oriented
Knowledge of visualization techniques would be an asset
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Ability to work under pressure to deliver within time-sensitive deadlines
Demonstrated interest in financial markets; ability to interpret economic news and market conditions; a CFA is a plus
Passionate to learn new technology
Successful candidates must be team players and exemplify CPP Investment Board’s guiding principles of high performance, integrity, and partnership

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Entry Level Consulting Analyst Development Program - Toronto - NAELFY23
Description:
We are:
 Co-creators with our clients. Working across governments, business and nonprofits, our clients trust us as smart partners to help them succeed. How does Accenture Consulting do it? We talk with our clients to understand their needs and what their goals are. Together we invent new ways of working and new tools. Whatever ideas we come up with, we move fast. We research the possibilities and rapidly deploy the solution to give them a leading edge. Visit us here to find out more about Accenture Consulting.

 Become a part of a unique culture that represents a global collective of diverse talent and people innovating together. We are omni-connected, there is no one-size-fits all - some teams are fully remote while others continue to meet with clients.

 You are:
 Unafraid to experiment. You are willing to share your ideas. You can see all around that the world is changing. Emerging technologies and next-generation IT excite you – you’re ready to put that passion to work. Customers want more; the average citizen wants more. And you know that in order to make change happen, you need to understand how things work today so you can improve them for tomorrow. You are ready to stretch boundaries – and yourself.

 The work:

 Kick-start your career in our Consulting Development Program to learn the latest skills, go through multiple project experiences that give the opportunity to learn new skills across industries
 Work closely with clients to learn how their business is working today
 Roll up your sleeves and come up with good ideas on how to improve business processes
 Join your teammates to dive into consulting projects, deliver new technologies and unique business solutions to world class clients
 Check out different cloud technologies that may be a good solution for the client’s need
 Analyze project statistics and business data to read the story behind the numbers
 Manage projects like a pro, tracking status, timeline, costs and delivery


 CDP - Applied Intelligence alignment

 Combine Artificial Intelligence with data, analytics, and automation under a strategic vision to scale AI and transform businesses
 Use quantitative methods and statistical models to create insights, patterns, and outcomes from data to inform strategic decisions
 Consulting AI Analysts should have a knowledge of programming languages and tools (ex. Python, R, SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, SAS/SPSS, TensorFlow, etc.), and prior work or coursework focusing on Data Analysis, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Automation, Analytics Transformation Strategy & Innovation, etc.




Here’s what you need:

 Major in any subject that has pushed you to think critically and given you opportunities to solve problems (i.e., business, economics, commerce, computer science, engineering, etc.)
 Are known for being analytical, looking at things from all angles and feel comfortable getting up in front of a group of people to lead workshops
 Familiarity with core consulting skills business, processes, organizational strategies, project management and an interest in technology
 Ability to adjust quickly and confidently when faced with change, engage and enables team members to reach a common goal, seek out answers, drive solutions and get results, and follow through on what you say you’ll do, while also knowing when to ask for help.
 Must be in final year of study in September 2022, graduating by August 2023


 How to Apply
 You must submit a cover letter, resume and transcript in order for your application to be considered for an interview. Application deadline is July 8, 2022 at 12:00 PM EST for the Toronto location only.
 Once your application is received, you will be invited to complete our virtual consulting experience through the Discovery Portal. Although this step is not mandatory to complete, we encourage you to try it out.

Title: Data & Business Analyst
Description:
Agio is a hybrid managed IT and cybersecurity provider servicing the financial services, health care and payments industries. The company has extensive experience supporting the alternative investment space, specializing in hedge funds, private equity firms and asset managers. Agio offers technology hosting, monitoring, management, helpdesk, disaster prevention and recovery, as well as managed security, 360° cybersecurity programs, virtual CISO (vCISO) support and cybersecurity consulting.
Agio Accelerator is a new part of Agio that is focused on building model-driven products to make IT service delivery simpler, smoother, and ultimately predictive. Do you want to help build a startup culture inside the best team of cybersecurity and IT service delivery professionals? Do you love data, visualization and storytelling? Do you want autonomy and the ability to provide insights that impact a multi-million dollar business? Then join us!JOB DESCRIPTIONWe are looking for a data analyst that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of IT service data and help us make smarter. Your primary focus will be on data exploration, reporting, and dashboards. You'll work with the product, data science, and engineering teams to provide insights to leadership and the wider business. This role will report to both the Chief of Staff and Head of Data Science.JOB SUMMARY

Own development of dashboards and data reporting
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in delivery of data insights
Innovate new solutions to our users' biggest problems using machine learning and other technologies as needed

RESPONSIBILITIES

Manage development and maintenance of PowerBI dashboards
Collaborate with internal teams to identify and integrate relevant data sources for reporting
Field ad hoc request and identify potential internal products based on repeat requests
Provide feedback to engineering team on data quality issues and improvements
Produce and maintain documentation where needed

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline
Proficient in PowerBI and Excel
Proficient in SQL
Understanding of databases
Strong communication and interpersonal skills

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE (NOT REQUIRED)
*

Knowledge of R or Python
Experience with MSPs (Managed Service Providers)
Familiarity with IT and/or cybersecurity as an industry

Perks & Benefits

Comprehensive benefits package with immediate coverage including health, vision, dental, disability, life insurance, and more
Uncapped Vacation
10 paid holidays
10 sick days
32 hours of paid volunteer time-off
Financial support including a competitive salary, pension with company match, and more
Commuter benefits within qualifying locations
Social events
Agio Swag
And more!

#LI-Remote
Agio is a blend of who we are and what we aspire to be. As an equal opportunity employer, we embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture that allows each of us to do our best work and be our best selves.

Title: Logistics Analyst 1
Description:
Logistics Analyst 1 - Remote Opportunity

 Job Overview Ensure all aspects of department shipments to and from sites locally and internationally comply with applicable regulations, courier specifications and study parameters. Resolve shipping problems related to customs, FDA and dangerous goods or couriers. Ensure on-line shipping program is maintained within laboratory policy and procedural guidelines and users are trained. Assist with strategic initiatives at a local level.

 Role Responsibilities:

 Assist with executing identified global initiatives at a local level within timelines
 Liaise with internal / external clients in relation to shipping regulations and logistics initiatives
 Advise Project Management on correct shipping materials and documentation to order for global studies
 Coordinate any special arrangements with couriers
 Gather data from PM about kit contents, site lists, etc.
 Prepare commercial invoices, letters of instruction, letters to airport police, and supply pre-printed air bills to sites to ensure specimens will be shipped in compliance with each country’s regulations and each courier’s specifications
 Operate all courier systems to prepare package address labels, invoices and other associated documentation correctly in a timely manner
 Liaise with courier IT departments to ensure prompt rectification of any system faults
 Ensure system upgrades are implemented with minimum impact to business
 Maintain all shipping machines address databanks and keep them up-to-date
 Liaise closely with Project Management to ensure accurate address details in QLIMS
 QC all shipping documentation prior to shipping and check shipments against manifest
 Track and trace shipments and follow up problem shipments to ensure they are progressed and delivered rapidly
 Monitor inventory level requirements and maintain a minimum operating stock level for all couriers’ material as required
 Train new staff in the operation of all courier systems
 Monitor processes within Logistics with a view to increase quality and efficiency of current method of operation
 Produce all courier manifest reports each evening and ensure these are retained as a record
 Responsible for all record keeping and archiving of quality data
 Maintain filing and archiving system for all shipping material for all couriers used
 Maintain a record of returned/damaged shipments and ensure that appropriate claims are submitted
 Produce monthly metrics reports relating to the Logistics group
 Maintain current knowledge of customs and shipping regulations/restrictions for import/export worldwide and communicate changes effectively
 Maintain current knowledge regarding Dangerous Goods shipping
 Ensure paperwork generated by photocopying is done in a quality manner to provide a professional appearance and faxed documentation is of a professional appearance prior to faxing


 Requirements: 

High School Diploma or equivalent is Required; Bachelor's Degree Preferred
 1-3 years of strong global shipping and logistics experience is Required, preferably from another CRO or pharma company
 Knowledge of regulatory requirements
 Self-starter


 Skills and Abilities:

 Good communication and problem-solving skills.
 Detail-oriented, thorough, and well-organized.
 Ability to grasp general concepts of import/export regulations.
 Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-stress environment.
 Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, managers and clients.


 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Policy, Planning And Research Analyst
Description:
Job Summary
 The Policy, Planning and Research Analyst is responsible for policy planning, research, and development of organizational initiatives within the Data Quality division of Infrastructure Support. Duties of this position will include but are not limited to the designing and implementation of internal policy to ensure compliance with government and industry standards for Infrastructure Support. Performing research on best practices and comparisons to similar entities to ensure best in class. Assisting in the preparation of strategic plans/annual reports and additional reporting requirements. Conducts research for a variety of stakeholders within the program. Provides statistical data analysis and reporting by developing databases, ensuring data integrity, performing data extracts for stakeholders and other various duties. Creating internal documents, reports, and presentations as needed. Responsible for the design, implementation and upkeep of user home pages that will show metrics of the Archibus system, the current software system that is used. Providing technical assistance to internal clients on Archibus and/or other infrastructure support applications. Administers surveys on behalf of the Infrastructure Support Department. Representing department on committees. Develops and delivers training to staff and other related duties as required.
 
 This position will require continual travel to all Eastern Health locations in the City, Rural Avalon and Peninsulas; overnight stays will be required.
 

Job Demands
 By applying for this job, you acknowledge an understanding that regular requirements and demands of this job include (but are not limited to):
  Occasionally required to lift/move objects, such as files and records up to 10 lbs. 
  Work provides the opportunity to occasionally stand, walk and bend and stretch within the office environment. 
  Constantly required to perform fine finger/precision work while sitting using a keyboard and mouse while entering and manipulating data in electronic documents, responding to information, updating databases, and preparing correspondence. 
  Visual concentration is required constantly for data entry and verification of information in spreadsheets as well as to write reports, emails and other correspondence. 
  Occasionally there is unusual/distracting noise, glare from computer monitors and lack of privacy.
  Exact results and precision are required when preparing reports, compiling statistical information, and responding to information requests. 
  Auditory concentration includes constant listening to multiple stakeholders requesting information, questioning for clarity and communicating complex responses. 
  Occasionally impacted by interruptions and multiple time pressures/deadlines for immediate results for data or information. Reporting deadlines occur regularly. 
  Work demands do not result in considerable fatigue requiring periods of rest. 
  Required to drive to various locations to perform work duties
 

Job Qualifications
 Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration/Commerce, Economics, Statistics or related field is required.
  Minimum of two years of experience within the last four in evaluation, data assessment and analysis is required.
  Certifications and/or experience in quality improvement/process improvement would be an asset.
  Experience with research evaluation would be an asset.
  Demonstrated proficiency of MS Office, as well as knowledge of research, and financial methods, techniques, and statistical analysis are required. 
  Demonstrated collaboration, superior oral and written communications skills, attention to detail and the ability to plan and organize is required.
  Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  Satisfactory driver's license and drivers abstract will be required.
  A satisfactory record of work performance and attendance is required.
 
 If this is an internal posting only, only applicants of the Eastern Health NAPE HS Regional Bargaining Unit will be considered. Otherwise, if this is posted internal and external, we will accept all applications, but preference will be given to those qualified candidates who are internal to the Eastern Health NAPE HS Regional Bargaining Unit.

Title: Data Strategy Business Analyst
Description:
About SickKids







Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
 When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
 Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.





 Position Description





SickKids Hospital Data Strategy is seeking a Business Analyst to join the team! 
SickKids’ vision of Unprecedented Outcomes Powered by Precision Child Health is anchored in having robust data. SickKids’ Enterprise Data Strategy has several key elements, one of which is the establishment of a centralized hub of analytics. 
In support of the SickKids Enterprise Data Strategy, we are seeking a dynamic Business Analyst who can balance multiple priorities and work collaboratively with leadership to support the implementation of core components of the Enterprise Data Strategy. The primary objective of this role is to support the Enterprise Data Strategy and the Precision Child Health Strategy with data quality, data stewardship and Data governance processes to ensure an efficient and seamless workflow. The Business Analyst will be facilitating and working collaboratively with cross-functional teams throughout the enterprise. The Business Analyst will also work collaboratively with counterparts at partnering institutions to facilitate the development of policies, procedures, and workflows to enable cross-institutional data sharing.
 Key Responsibilities

Support the Chief Data Officer and Precision Medicine Director to facilitate efforts in optimal data sharing with partnering institutions
Support structured approach to coordinate and resolve data quality issues as well as communication of status to various stakeholders
Coordinate root cause analysis and remediation plans for data quality issues
Coordinate work effort required on aligning deliverables in relation to data quality and stewardship activities
Prepare documentation of business rules and data definitions
Create and optimize policies for effective data sharing internally and externally 
Create and optimize policies and approaches for effective data management
Conduct and clarify business requirements sessions with stakeholders and manage scope expectations
Develop change requests and effectively communicate with both business teams and technical teams.
Provide status reporting on activities
Coordinating and preparing for governance committee and working groups
Provide superior client experience and strengthen relationship with project team and other stakeholders
Collaborate with project team across the organization and with counterparts at partnering institutions
Resolve conflicts/issues and escalate to others as appropriate


 Skills: 

Successful completion of an undergraduate degree or technical certification 
Previous employment involving business analysis 
Problem solving skills, out of box thinking, drive for innovation and ability to execute ideas.
Proven experience in business analysis methodologies and tools, including use cases, process flows, assessment frameworks, and capability modelling.
Proven experience facilitating a variety of engagement sessions and meetings with business owners, end users, and developers.
Ability to lead and thrive in a highly collaborative and consensus driven environment.
Strong Excel skills e.g., pivot tables, regression, vlookup(), if(), offset()
Ability to communicate complex quantitative ideas to a non-technical audience
Ability to work independently
Ability to work under pressure and within tight timelines
Ability to manage and prioritize simultaneous tasks and work
Familiar and capable with Microsoft Office, collaboration software, requirements management tools, process mapping tools
Previous healthcare experience is an asset
Previous project management experience is an asset

 Employment Type: Temporary, Full Time (2 Year Contract)








 Our Commitment to Diversity





The children and families we care for are from a variety of communities, and so are our employees. We welcome and encourage everyone to join our organization and be part of our team.
 When requested, SickKids will provide access and inclusion supports to eligible candidates to support their full engagement during the interview and assessment process. Information received related to access or inclusion will be addressed confidentially. 
Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
 FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a health care institution, our highest priority is the safety of patients, families and staff. As a result, we are adopting all prevention measures to ensure the safety of our patients, families and our staff. Therefore, any offer of employment is conditional upon you submitting proof that you have been fully vaccinated with a Health Canada or World Health Organization (WHO) approved COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible and no later than fourteen (14) calendar days prior to the effective start date, in addition to satisfying any other condition(s) that may be set out in an offer. If a candidate fails to satisfy this condition (or any other condition(s) set out in an offer), any offer of employment shall be immediately rescinded.
 How to Apply
 Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.
 If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
We are looking for a results-driven data savvy individual to be a Data Analyst. In this role you will be challenged to understand the details of business operations and their related data as part of our Decision Support, Analytics, and Data team. You are also required to build relationships with other teams such as Financial Planning & Analysis, Customer and Brand, Merchandising, Store Operations, Ecommerce and Supply chain which will be a key part of this role.Good technical skills along with sound business acumen, and curiosity will allow you to succeed in this role. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do: 

Work with Decision Support Analysts to understand and gather requirements such that it aligns with Business objectives thereby helping teams to make better data decisions. Business objectives thereby helping teams to make better data decisions. 
Support development and enhancement of data table design related to customer data, and engagement of customers across the CTC family of companies. 
Support development of customer profitability modelling, by establishing customer data connections, optimization of metrics gathering production. 
Use your business acumen to better understand metrics used in our analysis and reporting to enhance how we access and use data within the organization. 
Propose sound approaches to interpret data to the Business team which would enable the teams to easily work with and communicate complex ideas. 
Support the testing activities with the Business teams to meet data accuracy standards set by the organization. Work with appropriate teams to resolve issues identified. 
Apply and espouse the principles of good design with respect to databases, programs, and reports to simplify ongoing support and enhance sustainability. 

What you bring: 

University degree – Computer Science, Business, Analytics, Information Systems, or related background. 
Strong business acumen. 
Strong working experience with SQL, SAS and Python. 
Experience building customer data marts and establishing customer level data relationships across several systems. 
Experience working with Hadoop, Snowflake, Azure Cloud, or similar environments. 
Experience on an end-to-end data acquisition (source to raw layer to transformed layer) process is a definite asset. 
Have a strong knowledge or hands-on experience of good database and programming design principles. 
Ensure that significant design decisions are communicated, validated, and adhered to. 
Provide rationale for design decisions. 
Experience with mapping, defining, and managing business processes. 
Experience working with a relational database and with large and complex datasets is an asset 
Experience with Data Profiling and Metadata Tools 
Strong analytical, communication and proactive problem-solving skills are necessary. 
Understanding of financial reporting principles and business reporting is important to effective performance in role. 
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). 
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to accept/action constructive feedback. 
Advanced written and verbal communication skills. 
Customer oriented, focused on achieving project objectives and customer satisfaction. 
Provides a positive influence and excels in a self-directed team environment. 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Title: Fuel Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Fuels Marketing Team within the Petroleum Division of Canadian Tire is responsible for the overall profitability of the Fuels business (gas and propane) for the corporation. This requires a dedicated team managing relationships with our key vendor partners, negotiating fuel and transportation costs, as well as retail (street) pricing for all grades of gas and diesel for our 288 gas bar locations across Canada within each market. 
Reporting to the Fuels Marketing Manager – the Fuels Data Analyst is accountable for providing overall support to the Fuels Marketing Team. This support includes both routine-daily reporting using existing data and analytical processes as well as conducting more in-depth analysis to ensure that the business is fully optimized from a pricing & margin standpoint in each of the markets we operate. This in-depth analysis requires the development & design of MS Access Queries & Tables to effectively access the data we have stored in various databases. 
What You'll Do 
ROUTINE DAILY FUELS MANAGEMENT SUPPORT 

Provide analytical support to the Fuels Marketing Team through daily reporting (eg. Margin Reports, Exception Reports, Incidents Reports, etc…) 
Daily cost updates – Shared responsibility with the Fuels Pricing Analyst on entering and updating supplier cost data in the AS400 system. Verify from Source documents that the information entered into the system is accurate and complete. 
Provide additional analysis for the 401/400 HWY series locations. 
Conduct ongoing analytics and reviews of ‘Margin Exceptions’ for each site to identify challenges as well as opportunities to engage in price restoration activities. 
Support the Fuels Marketing Team to implement special regulatory projects. 
Back up Fuels Pricing Analyst on communicating with fuel suppliers and transportation vendors on the day-to-day operations. 
Weekly update to the CT Hub Propane Pricing Notification. 
Infrequent Pricing Desk call centre coverage as well as routine release of day-end reports 
Provide back-up support to the Fuels Marketing Team as necessary. 

IN-DEPTH DATA ANALYTICS SUPPORT 

Conduct pricing/margin analysis to ensure that retail pricing ‘philosophies’ for each gas bar location are optimized to ensure the right balance of profitability and competitiveness. 
Leverage industry data (eg. Kalibrate data) to perform regular benchmarking analysis. 
Create MS Access queries & tables as required to help support the team effectively. 
Work with the Petroleum FP&A Team in managing both upstream and downstream data requirements. 
Analyze fuel grade spreads for each market and Identify trends and opportunities where necessary. 
Engage with the team to design and implement enhancements to current processes. 
Ensure that the Propane business is fully optimized at each location in terms of overall profitability and competitiveness. 
Support the Operations Team on developing the necessary reporting for the annual ‘Performance Plus’ Program. 
Become a subject matter expert (SME) on the AS400 system with the ability to create ad hoc reports and conduct necessary data mining. 
Respond to inquiries from Senior Management and FP&A as required. 

What you bring 

High degree of proficiency with the MS Office Suite of products, primarily Access and Excel 
Experience in MS Access database query design and/or SQL knowledge 
University degree is an asset 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and provide recommendations 
1-3 years of business experience in an analytical role is an asset 
Excellent verbal and written presentation skills 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies .
