Title: Data Analyst (Canada)
Description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Analysts to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership have been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

 Position Overview:
 The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (Bureau) regulations require lenders to ensure that the issued billing statements and any tax information (to get federal tax benefits) shared with student loan customers are accurate. The Student Loans division and the candidates working for this team would work on redressing the impacted customers. This would be done through investigation, remediation, and execution for redressal.

 Responsibilities:

Work through multiple data files (Excel or otherwise) to ensure the accuracy of the captured information - rates, balances, loan agreements, file name, extracted data from the company database, and other supporting files/customer data etc.
Enter data, fill out new data templates based on already collected data to create case packages
Create, maintain, and modify documentation for the followed processes

Requirements

Bachelor’s in quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, finance, economics, accounting or engineering
1-3 years of professional experience as Data analyst – data entering, data validation, working with Excel data files (pivots, vlookups etc.)
1-2 years of experience in writing SQL queries
Experience with documentation of operational process is desired but not mandatory

Benefits
 Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Title: Performance Analyst I, Virtual Care - TELUS Health
Description:
Location: Montreal, Quebec, CA Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Ottawa, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA 
    







     Req ID: 26661 
    







     Jobs by Category: Health 
    







     Job Function: Health Solutions 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies?


Who we are


At TELUS Health, we are on a mission to create innovative technologies and services that drive our vision, which is to create a healthier world, one life at a time. We are a market leader in the rapidly growing industry of virtual care.


We enable employers to offer to their employees a secure online access to medical practitioners and nurses via a computer, tablet, or smartphone. Telemedicine is the biggest trend in employee benefits and an exponential number of companies are looking to offer the service in the near future.


The Reporting and Analysis team is responsible for developing interactive visualizations and dashboards from multiple sources, providing actionable insights for the business. Our team consists of motivated business, data and performance analysts who share the desire to unearth the nuggets of information that support effective decision-making.


We specifically analyze performance data across all TELUS Health Virtual Care products and offerings (Primary Care, Disability management, Specialized Digital Therapy…) and support multiple divisions (Client Success, Marketing, Operations, Products…) while working with cross-functional teams and leadership. We embrace and thrive in a highly dynamic and competitive environment.


As the Performance Analyst, you will primarily be responsible for ensuring quality data structures for the analysis of data, use of proper statistical analysis, and implementing visualization best practices in creating content through Advanced Excel (power query) and Metabase.


You will be working with a variety of data sources to develop, and implement data and business intelligence applications to enable management and customers to make data-driven business and critical decisions.




 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together




As a Performance and data Analyst in the Reporting and Analysis team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining innovative self-serve reporting solutions that drive insights into the performance of all products under THVC in order to guide strategy and decision-making.


You are a subject matter expert proficient in enabling insights and analytics with technology. Your expertise in analytic platforms like Advanced Excel (power query) and Metabase along with your working knowledge of building data pipelines, tables, and views contribute to a mandate that allows our management and customers to unlock information that enables their decision-making.


You will be working with a team of talented analysts and data experts to build a self-serve reporting environment. In addition, you will assist our stakeholders in translating their needs into feasible and usable data solutions. As a builder, you will collaborate with a team of talented resources to build enriched dashboards and data pipelines to enable management to take guided and informed decisions to accomplish goals and produce desired results.


Our team loves



Learning and it extends to our passion to understand the “why” behind the data so we can provide value to the organization
Collaborating and our mix of business acumen and technical skills are optimal in delivering data insights and unpacking business rationale for our stakeholders
Winning and we are champions of Big Data - we believe timely data centric analysis and insights are critical to our ability to win in the market


 
Here is how:



Develop new and innovative ways to present reporting insights, with flexibility for users to self-serve and drill into the data
Work closely with different stakeholders to articulate new KPI reporting requirements
Collaborate with data experts to actively manage the performance of the platform of visual dashboards and reports
Work closely with cross-functional teams and data experts to enable a data environment that automates our stakeholders’ needs with the balance on efficiency and accuracy
Analyze and determine information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements and data output and reporting capabilities
Coordinate new data development, ensuring consistency and integration with the existing data warehouse structure


 
You must be comfortable working within a dynamic, cross-functional environment and be able to understand, and explain complex concepts, performance reporting methodologies, and analysis results to a diverse stakeholder community. Your familiarity and comfort with TELUS Health Virtual Care is desirable and you must be willing to roll up your sleeves and get close to the data.






 Qualifications




What You Bring:



Post-secondary diploma / certification
2+ years working experience in a market/business intelligence, database marketing and data-warehousing environment
Strong experience in leveraging MS office and Metabase to develop self-served dashboards and reports
Strong presentation, analytical and data interpretation skills
Ability to define scope, objectives, and prioritize work demands within a dynamic environment
Possess an innovative, problem-solving, and solutions-oriented mindset
Ability to learn quickly, be a team player, and manage multiple work projects
Strong knowledge of best practices for dashboards and visualization


 
Great-to-haves:



Hands-on Metabase and MS Office experience
Knowledge of Virtual Health business models, measures and metrics
Deep experience with data visualizations and tools, preferably Advanced Excel and Metabase experience
Strong analytical skills and comfortable working with large data sets
Ability to transform data into actionable insights

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Under the general direction of the Manager of Innovation & Technology, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for acting as the intermediary between the business and IT, using a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business partners achieve their desired outcomes. The analyst documents business goals and requirements, analyzes system and organizational changes required to support business goals, analyzes and designs business processes, creates functional specifications, co-designs prototypes and innovative solutions with the development team, develops project documentation and training to support organizational change, and develops and executes test plans to ensure the solution delivers the expected business value.
 As the Business Systems Analyst you will:

Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business needs and systems goals.
Solicit and document requirements or user stories through interviews, workshops, and reviews of existing documentation/procedures.
Perform gap analysis between current and desired future state, documenting existing business processes, analyzing the effectiveness and efficiency of these processes, defining opportunities for process improvements, assessing organizational change capability and system impacts, and making recommendations.
Create system and process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction and support business process improvement and innovation.
Develop and support the creation of Request for Proposals (RFP) and Business Cases.
Partner with technical team to interpret business needs and assist in solution design and evaluation.
Work with other project resources to design, conduct, and analyze tests in order to discover and report any defects, bugs, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.
Provide guidance in user acceptance testing.
Develop departmental computer standards and policies.
Document the technical and operational environment.
Prepare service requests and service response documents.
Perform other related duties consistent with the classification, as assigned.

 Your education and qualifications include:


A University Degree in a related discipline (Computer Science, Engineering or Business Administration) or an equivalent combination of training and experience.


At least 3 years of progressive business systems analysis experience.


Experience leading the analysis effort on major initiatives.


Experience in process and data modelling and analysis.


Experience working with senior stakeholders to surface strategic business needs/ goals.


Experience in creating test plans, writing test cases, and software application testing.


Experience in implementing SharePoint, FileNet, or other Enterprise Content Management systems would be an asset.


Strong written communication and documentation skills with ability to produce clear and concise business requirements and functional specifications.


Verbal communication skills; able to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and with external departments and organizations.


Ability to lead/ facilitate requirements workshops and design sessions.


Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with employees at all levels of the organization, external contacts and the public, in accordance with the Respectful Workplace Policy.


Strong knowledge of business analysis principles and best practices.


Possess a strong knowledge of IT concepts and IT project life cycle.


 Conditions of employment:

The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
A Police Information Check (Vulnerable Sector) Satisfactory to the employer will be required from the applicant(s) or successful candidate(s), at their expense. To obtain a Police Information Check please visit www.winnipeg.ca/police. 

CORE COMPETENCIES for ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG:

Citizen & Customer Focus
Respecting Diversity
Ethics and Values
Integrity and Trust
Results Oriented

Title: Analyst I, Identity and Access Management
Description:
Please note this is a 6 month contract



   Who we are
 


   Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.
  
 We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.
  
 Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.
 


   What you'll do
 


   As an Analyst I, Identity and Access Management, you bring conceptual knowledge of theories, practices, and procedures within a technical job discipline. You will perform standard technical assignments (e.g. bug fixes, database set up and maintenance, issue tracking) and develop a deeper understanding of technical concepts. You will work within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines. You will receive technical guidance and direction from more senior level roles. This role is entry level to a technical professional career progression and reports to the Team Lead, Identity and Access Management.
 

 Manage and administer Moneris network, host application, application access requests company wide.
Conduct identity life cycle management via SailPoint tool.
Provide day-to-day support to Moneris Help Desk, Moneris Users and 3rd Party Vendors with requisite operational procedures.
Perform internal daily, weekly, and quarterly access audits as regulated by each Sponsor, security policy or Internal audit.
Identified gaps in systems and area for process improvement
Responsible for creating, updating and maintaining procedures related to the administration and management of user IDs
Conduct user acceptance testing and assist project teams wherever necessary
Conduct attestations for applications and privileged access to minimize risk exposure in Moneris and maintain compliance



   What you bring
 

Bachelor's degree required, or equivalent work experience
Less than 2 years of work experience supporting the administration of centralized Identity and Access Management platform



   What you get
 

The chance to be part of one of Canada’s top employers and leader in FinTech
Competitive pay and annual bonus program based on individual performance and productivity
Emphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a few
RRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan
Flexible benefits package starting from day 1
Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model - including a tech peripheral rebate!
Extensive learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses!
Lots of opportunities to advance your career – 30% of Moneris' roles are filled internally
EAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition Program
Employee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors!
Get involved in one or many of our Moneris Committees and Employee Resource Groups - Inclusive Workplace Council (IWC), Black Employee Network, just to name a few



   Who you'll work with
 


   Our Technology team's goal is to connect ideas and technology to create solutions that shape the way people pay. Connection is in our DNA, and we are a team enabling our merchants, business partners, and each other with the tools we need to thrive. We're a team of over 400+ people, broken into six functions, who oversee all technology aspects at Moneris, including software, infrastructure engineering, cyber security, data analytics, and project management.
 



    Learn more about how Moneris is striving to be at the forefront of Fintech!
  



   Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Title: Supply Chain - Analyst, Supply Chain Operations
Description:
THE TEAM
 

   The mission of Supply Chain Operations Department is to be the planning and execution support system for the Supply Chain Sub-Division, facilitating day-to-day operations.
 


   THE OPPORTUNITY
 

   As a member of the Supply Chain Operations Department, you will be part of the team responsible for ensuring the most effective and efficient performance of our Supply Chain Sub-Division. As the Analyst, you will support in enabling the seamless execution of key divisional and cross-functional programs and functions through effective operational management of people, process, technology, and space. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Network Support to continued growth and development with Aritzia.
 


   THE ROLE
 

   As the Analyst, Supply Chain Operations, you will:
 

 Drive the quality and timeliness of activities required for key lifecycles (such as, Sales Events, New Store Openings, and Season Launches) while continuously improving and maintaining infrastructure
 Assist with planning for the volume of orders, units and returns that are expected to come through Supply Chain using historical trends and industry best practices
 Support with aligning business needs with workforce requirements for today and tomorrow
 Actively manage our network inventory trends and maintain agility in our network
 Partner with the appropriate cross-functional stakeholders to continuously improve and actively manage our eComm & Retail packaging trends, maintaining agility within our network
 Support with packaging volume consumption management across our distribution network ensuring that we have the right materials, at the right time, at the appropriate facilities
 Integrate new infrastructure and represent Supply Chain’s interests cross-functionally



   THE QUALIFICATIONS
 

   The Analyst, Supply Chain Operations has:
 

 Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in data analytics
 Experience working with Business Intelligence tools
 A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values, Business and People Leadership principles
 The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners.
 A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value to the business



   THE PERKS
 

   Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:
 

 The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
 Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store
 Amenities - Facilities include private parent's room, bike storage rooms, and shower facilities with complimentary conveniences



   ARITZIA
 


 Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected 
characteristic.



 Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Market Research Analyst
Description:
Job Description 
Company Overview 

At Fidelity, our mission is to build a better future for Canadian investors and help them stay ahead. We offer investors and institutions a range of innovative and trusted investment portfolios to help them reach their financial and life goals. 

As a privately-owned company, our people and world class resources are committed to doing what is right for investors and their long term success. Our clients have entrusted us with $181 billion in asset under management (as of June 20, 2022) and they include individuals, financial advisors, pension plans, endowments, foundations and more. 

We are proud to provide investors a full range of investment solutions through mutual funds and exchange-traded funds, including a domestic, international and global equity, income-oriented strategies, asset allocation solutions, managed portfolios, sustainable investing and our high net work program. Fidelity Funds are available through a number of advice-based distribution channels including financial planners, investment dealers, banks and insurance companies. 

FIC has more than 1000 full time employees and is headquartered in Toronto, with regional offices in Montreal, Calgary and Vancouver. 

Business Overview 

The Market Research team is part of Fidelity Canada’s Corporate Affairs group, and provides market and/or competitive insights to support the firm’s business development, thought leadership and strategic planning efforts. 

The Opportunity 

We are looking for a Market Research Analyst to join our team. Reporting to the Director, Research, the Analyst will be a natural communicator with a strong analytical foundation and innate curiosity. This role is responsible for analyzing, interpreting and communicating insightful market and/or competitive research in support of business development, thought leadership and strategic business planning for Fidelity Canada. You will gain diverse exposure to Fidelity's functional areas and leadership teams and will have the opportunity to see tangible results from your research. 

What You Will Do 

Primary Research: Assist with Fidelity Canada’s primary research program including questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. You will play a meaningful role in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards for key internal partners. 
Secondary Research: Support Fidelity Canada’s advisor and institutional business lines with demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities, working closely with industry-leading market research partners to inform strategic decision making. 
Project Management: Oversee strategic projects for the Corporate Affairs group including scheduling, collaborating with internal and external partners, identifying risks, and reporting. 


What We’re Looking for: 

A minimum of 3 years' relevant experience is required, preferably in the financial services / asset management / market research industries 
A Bachelors degree in a business, economics or quantitative focus area 
A Post-graduate degree in a business or quantitative subject area (including MBA) is an asset 
Bilingualism in English and French is an asset 
Completion of the CSC designation is preferred 
Completion of the MRIA designation is considered an asset, as well as other investment-focused designations CFA/CAIA/CIM/etc 


What You Will Bring 

Solid understanding of the financial services and asset management industry. 
Excellent analytical and quantitative ability with proven skills in conducting sophisticated data analysis. 
Excellent oral and written communicator with well-developed data visualization and presentation skills. 
An avid learner who stays ahead of trends and is confident in their ability to learn new technologies and adapt to constantly evolving demands. 
Ability to work well under pressure while maintaining high standards. 
Ability to establish rapport and credibility with stakeholders including business leaders at all levels. 


Fidelity Benefits and Perks! 

100% remote and hybrid work arrangements 
Competitive total compensation package 
Company contributes into your RRSP, without a matching requirement from you 
Health benefits and coverage, 100% employee paid premiums, including up to $5000 for therapy 
Health Care Spending Account 
Health and Fitness Reimbursement 
Up to $650 for home office equipment 
Generous time off policy, including 2 paid days annually to volunteer 
Access to over 11,000 training and development courses 
Tuition reimbursement 
Monetary awards for completing a required designation 
Pregnancy/Parental/Adoption Leave - Fidelity will top-up to 100% of your salary for a period of 25 weeks 


Current work authorization for Canada is required for all openings. 
Employment with Fidelity will be conditional upon the successful candidate having received a COVID-19 vaccine series approved by Health Canada, at least 14 days prior to their start date. This requirement is subject to exemptions pursuant to human rights legislation in your province of employment. 

Fidelity Canada is an equal opportunity employer 
Fidelity Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, family status, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected ground. 

Accommodation during the application process 
Fidelity Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please email us at FidelityCanadaStaffing@fidelity.ca . 

No telephone inquiries or agencies please. We thank all applicants for their interest, please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. 

Why Work at Fidelity? 

We are proud to be recipients of the following: 

Awards 

Canada’s Top 100 Employers (5th consecutive year) 2021 
Greater Toronto’s Top Employers (9th consecutive year) 2021 
Canada’s Top Family Friendly Employer (4th consecutive year) 2021 
Imagine Canada, Caring Company 
Canada’s Top Employer For Young People 2021 
National HR Awards - Best Corporate Social Responsibility Program Award, Venngo Healthy Workplaces Award 
Workplace Benefits Awards – Health and Wellness Program 
Canadian Compassionate Companies Award 


Designations

An Imagine Canada Caring Company

Title: Senior Fire Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 36592

 Company
Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.


Vancouver Fire Rescue Services (VFRS) is an equal opportunity employer who is looking for a highly motivated individual to join our family of Fire Fighters, Fire Prevention Officers, Public Education Professionals, Chief Officers and Administrative Staff. VFRS prides itself on being one of the most progressive fire departments in North America while at the same time maintaining a strong sense of tradition. Vancouver Fire Rescue Services invites qualified candidates to apply for the position of Senior Fire Data Analyst.


 Main Purpose and Function


The Senior Fire Data Analyst is responsible for data modeling and data integration work related to the design and delivery of analytic data visualizations for VFRS consumption. The position will be responsible for designing, configuring and implementing analytic solutions to support the strategic direction for the Department. Using a variety of tools and technologies, the role works as part of the Organizational Performance and Business Operations team, and is responsible for: (a) design and creation of consumable data for analytic purposes, (b) rapid development of data models to address a number of wide ranging analytic challenges, (c) design and build-out of an analytic ecosystem architecture that supports both central data application creation as well as enabling self-service advanced business analytics and (d) supporting the design and adoption of data governance and data management. Technologies in use or may be used in the future include: Qlik, PowerBI, Excel, FDM, SMS, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP AOLAP, SQL Server and SQL DataWarehouse, and ESRI/GIS. The position interfaces with key business leaders from VFRS as well as the City’s Corporate Leadership team. The work performed will enable VFRS to leverage performance metrics to support strategic, operation and financial decisions as well as support service transformation by driving accountability, improving transparency and increasing value for money.


Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships


The position reports to the Assistant Chief of Analytics & Decision Support. The position calibrates tools to translate raw data into valuable business insights and provides insights and recommendations to senior staff using strong logical reasoning skills and business intelligence to drive high performance and quality.


Specific Duties/Responsibilities



Understand business needs and objectives and provide evidence-based support to develop business cases for resourcing needs such as staffing levels.
Lead and support the development of strategies for effective data analysis and reporting to support departmental strategic direction.
Develop, monitor and analyze performance metrics, financial data and benchmarks to establish the cost efficiency and effectiveness of services.
Provide data analysis and financial decision support which could include financial modelling, business analysis, and business case development
Create a standard department wide methodology for benchmarking performance and efficiency
Configure and support the implementation of qualitative and quantitative analytics solutions to further departmental goals and strategic plans.
Design and create consumable data analytics, including departmental metrics, using BI tools. 
Identify and correct data discrepancies and build a data quality assurance model.
Extract data and reports from multiple sources (e.g. Operations, Training, and Prevention) and maximize the utilization of the Departmental BI tool.
Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights and reportable goals.
Apply industry knowledge to interpret data and improve performance.
Keep abreast of industry news and trends and apply to data systems to provide relevant metrics.
Provide analysis supporting the short term and long term departmental direction including providing supporting metrics for the same.
Design and document performance measurement framework.
Present findings with departmental leaders and other stakeholders. 
Develop and maintain user training and documentation.
Perform other duties as assigned.


 
Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management or related field or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 
Preferred Masters of Business Analytics (MBAN), or Professional accounting designation (CPA), or Masters of Business Administration (MBA) 
Minimum of 6-8 years of experience supporting business information systems, business intelligence or reporting systems, and two (2) years project management experience.
Experience in supporting and developing strategies to support major corporate decisions and identifying performance measures to inform strategic decisions.
Business intelligence experience, familiarity with data management, BI tools, data mining, designing reports and dashboards to facilitate evidence based effective decision making.
Extensive experience in strategically answering complex business problems through data analysis, scenario modeling and creative thinking.
Initiating business process improvements, supporting strategic decisions and change initiatives for a large organization.
Significant experience in supporting and facilitating complex multi-stakeholder initiatives and engagements
Experience with the creation and presentation of public information (formal/informal reports, other publications) as well as engagement involving a diverse range of stakeholders.
Proven ability to simultaneously manage multiple organizational priorities, projects, and deadlines.


 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Thorough knowledge of rules, regulations, policies, standard operational guidelines and standards within a fire service environment.
Advanced knowledge of performance metrics, finance, and business concepts.
Strong business acumen and the ability to link financial and operational metrics. 
Working knowledge in project management and market research.
Knowledge of current Business analysis techniques.
Advanced knowledge of Data modeling and data management principles.
Knowledge of Road Network building and manipulation.
Knowledge of Qlik, PowerBI, Excel, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP AOLAP, SQL Server and SQL DataWarehouse, and ESRI/GIS; familiarity with other business intelligence tools.
Significant in-depth working knowledge of computers, computer systems, programs and capabilities.
Knowledge of Fire, medical or other emergency services is preferred.
A proven record of being forward thinking, coupled with the skills of being able to articulate ideas in both written and verbal form.
Extensive experience and analytical skills in reaching sound decisions and resolving complex problems.
Demonstrated analytical skills and strong organizational abilities.
A good understanding of Fire culture would be an asset.



Business Unit/Department: Analytics & Business Support/Fire Rescue Services
Affiliation: Exempt
Employment Type: Temporary Full Time - 1 Year
Position Start Date: August 22nd 2022
Position End Date: August 25th 2023
Salary Information: Pay Band: 8 Exempt - $89283.00 per annum


Application Close: July 21st 2022


At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Title: Health Data Analyst
Description:
Health Data Analyst
Full-time Location: within BC Closing Date: Open Until Filled 
BCPSQC is committed to an equitable, diverse and inclusive workforce. We recognize that there are a variety of experiences that contribute to the overall qualifications for each role. If you feel that you could excel in this position, but do not necessarily meet the formal requirements, we want to hear from you! 
In particular, we encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas at the Council to apply. 
Role SummaryThe BC Patient Safety & Quality Council builds a foundation of quality, provides advice and makes recommendations to the Minister of Health on matters related to patient safety and quality of care in all health care sectors. The Council brings health system stakeholders together in partnership to promote and inform provincially coordinated, innovative, and patient- and family-centred approaches to patient safety and quality in British Columbia.
Reporting to the Director, Analytics & Strategic Initiatives, the Health Data Analyst is responsible for performing statistical analysis and generating meaningful displays of data to inform data-driven improvements. This includes working with subject matter experts to determine requirements, processing data from a variety of sources, conducting analyses and preparing reports for presentation to diverse audiences. Working in partnership with the Council’s quality and clinical leads, the Health Data Analyst will be looked to as an expert in measurement and analysis to support the effective use of data in improvement, research and evaluation.
Key Accountabilities

Receive, analyze and support the interpretation of clinical data, in conjunction with subject matter experts, to inform provincial improvement initiatives. This includes receiving data from multiple sources, cleaning the data as required, analyzing the data, working with subject matter experts to identify meaningful trends and producing findings that can be shared with a variety of stakeholders.
Advise Council teams on the creation of robust measurement plans, including the selection of indicators, data collection methods, interpretation and analysis options for multiple purposes such as research, evaluation and improvement initiatives.
Develop reports and presentations to share relevant findings with diverse audiences, including the creation of compelling and intuitive displays of data.
Provides advice, guidance, and support, to quality and clinical leads, along with external stakeholders, on using data for improvement, evaluation and research.

QualificationsA level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science, Math, Statistics, Business or Health Administration, or a related program, plus three (3) years recent related experience. Experience with statistical analysis and quality improvement is preferred, along with a working knowledge of health care data sources and relevant privacy legislation. Proficiency with a variety of software tools is essential, including Microsoft Office, database software and SPSS or equivalent. Experience with Statistical Process Control techniques is an asset. The successful candidate will possess exceptional analytic capability and attention to detail, including the ability to manage multiple demands and pressures while producing high quality work. Problem solving, curiosity and self-motivation are essential. Working with a diverse team and external stakeholders, the Health Data Analyst will need to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with tact and diplomacy.
Closing date: Open until filled.
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with the BC Patient Safety & Quality Council as of October 26, 2021.
Note: Only short-listed candidates will be contacted; others will be kept in our database for future consideration.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Extended health care

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why Work for Us?
 Innovation. Act with Integrity. Collaboration. Embrace Diversity. Care
 We come from many countries, cultures, races, ethnicities, abilities and nationalities. We bring our passions including singing, biking, swimming, dancing, cooking, volunteering, parenting, coaching and much more! We are proud of our nearly equal balance of men and women and strengthened by our non-binary and transgender team members. Every employee belongs.
 We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive benefits and an environment that recognizes and rewards performance.
 Company Description
 Zymeworks is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, development and commercialization of next-generation bispecific and multifunctional biotherapeutics, initially focused on the treatment of cancer. Zymeworks’ suite of complementary therapeutic platforms and its fully-integrated drug development engine provide the flexibility and compatibility to precisely engineer and develop highly-differentiated product candidates.
 Zymeworks is seeking a highly-motivated Data Analyst who is looking to grow their career with our company.
 This position will report to the Associate Director of Enterprise Applications and can be based either in our offices in Vancouver BC or Remote (Canada).
 As a condition of employment, Zymeworks requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and provide verification of such.
 Key Responsibilities

 Develops tools for Zymeworks’ scientific data system’s integrations, and visualization of many forms of data including scientific R&D data.
 Participates in requirement analysis with our scientific R&D teams to understand the experimental data being produced, provides proposals to organize and formalize the data from these experiments, and works on developing tools to store this data in the system. 
Use multiple system API’s to extract and transform data to a standard format to be used by scientific staff/end users. 
Create workflows and visual dashboard for presentation of a variety of data. 
Manages and organizes the storage of our biological data (protein products, antibodies, small molecules, other molecular entities) in the LIMS/ELN/Inventory, along with associated metadata. 
Performs daily administrative tasks such as data administration and access control of the scientific software systems. 
Works with our in-house lab scientists, and external Contract Research Organizations to develop, document, and enforce standard operating procedures and protocols for our experiments and the associated data upload and management procedures. 
Works with the vendors and in-house scientific and software teams to implement and support best practices and optimal utilization of the informatics and data management resources. 
Documents and trains scientific staff/end users on best practices and compliance policies related to the scientific data system and data handling.

 Qualifications and Education

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Chemistry and a minimum of 2 years’ related experience working with data management software in the biopharmaceutical industry or similar data management software or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 Skills and Abilities

 Working experience with programming languages (Python, C/C++, Java, Perl). 
Working experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Spotfire). 
Basic knowledge of databases like SQL, PostgreSQL. 
Working knowledge of ELN / LIMS / Molecule Registration systems.
 Demonstrated experience with Information Technology standards and practices such as Change Management, SDLC, ITIL. 
Strong drive to work in data management including capturing, refining, annotating, characterizing, and storing data. 
Self-starter, team player, problem solver who is highly flexible and responsive to evolving project needs. 
Familiarity with using different API tools. 
Fluent in written and spoken English.
 Familiarity with proteins, protein expression and purification methods is an asset, as well as basic knowledge of experiments like mass spectroscopy, DSC, SPR, FACS, ELISA or other cell-based assays. 
Experience in negotiating software requirements within and across research departments and translating those requirements to software solutions. 
Experience in the capture and management of high throughput experimental data. 
Experience working with / building ETL tools and familiarity with data warehousing concepts

 NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: Zymeworks values our relationships with our Recruitment Partners. We will only accept resumes from those partners whom have been contracted by a member of our Human Resources team to collaborate with us. Zymeworks is not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received without contract.
 #LI-PT1

Title: Junior Business Analyst
Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Maplesoft Group is currently seeking a Sr. Data Analyst one of our clients in the National Capital Region.
 
 The following responsibilities are associated with the “Statement Of Work” but are not limited to:
 
 Description of Service
 
 The Master Data Management (MDM) Program is an intensive multi-year initiative to implement a solution that will standardize, consolidate and significantly improve the client’s use of core enterprise data. In 2022, the MDM team will focus on the delivery of a Proof of Value (PoV) MDM solution for assessment by EDC business and technology stakeholders. This effort will be followed by the first production release of the solution. The MDM team is using an Agile approach (Scrum) for the MDM delivery.
 
 Primary Responsibilities
 


Senior Data Analysis services will contribute to the detailed data analysis and design of the MDM solution. The selected candidate will perform key functions to: catalog master and reference data; define data requirements and business rules; perform data profiling; document data processes/flows; document data mapping details; assist standard operating procedure (SOP) analysis and documentation; assist data dictionary definition; perform data quality assessment and testing to align with EDC data governance and quality standards.



Senior Data Analysis services also requires understanding of client ask, working with clients to further refine the details. Deep dive into the business rules and data transformation rules requirements. Data flow diagrams will need to be created for visual representation of data transformation between internal and external systems.



The Senior Data Analyst will be expected to ramp up quickly on current state data architecture and become familiar with client’s data governance and data quality standards.

 Specific Project Requirements
 


Collecting, documenting, and analyzing MDM data requirements



Data profiling/analysis and data querying



Data cleansing, data transformation



Documenting/mapping business processes, SOPs



Building crosswalks and mapping tables for reference data



Analyzing source systems to find discrepancies/collisions for reference data



Working with team members to provide data analysis and design leadership and communicate about deliverables, schedule, possible risks, and appropriate contingencies



Working closely and collaboratively with management, stakeholders, and staff to optimize the overall MDM delivery

 Skills
 
 Top 3 Skills:
 


Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data analysis and profiling, working with multiple data sources and stakeholder groups including end-user/business teams.



Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience in data quality analysis and experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights



 Other Skills:
 


Prior experience with Informatica MDM (is an asset).



Strong SQL/SQL query skills.



Experience with JSON, XML, and Databricks Parquet data structures and transformations.



Prior experience on MDM/data standardization and consolidation initiatives is an asset.



 Assets:
 


A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related degree.



10+ years of broad experience in IM/IT solution design and delivery, including working knowledge with infrastructure, database platform, middleware, and applications.



Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming, ETL development, metadata management and master data management, business intelligence and database administration.



Good understanding and practical implementation experience with integration design patterns. Strong understanding of Data Management Body of Knowledge is a plus.



Excellent verbal and written communication, critical thinking, time management, priority planning and interpersonal skills.


 Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees.
 
 Maplesoft Group is committed to having a diverse, representative workforce and continuing to build an inclusive environment. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Maplesoft Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal peoples or any other legally protected factors.
 
 All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications.
 
 We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and a work environment that supports our diverse workforce. Please let us know if you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process. We can be reached at Maplesoft Info at info@maplesoftgroup.com.
 
 We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise you, that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Why Fraser Health?: 
 
   Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
 


 Effective October 26th, 2021 all staff for all positions across Health Care require full COVID 19 vaccination. All positions, require that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and there are no exceptions.
 


 Position Highlights


   We are currently looking to fill an exciting 
  Full Time position as a 
  Business Analyst at Central City Tower located in 
  Surrey, BC.



 Valued Benefits


   A career with Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to be a part of a dedicated team of professionals in a dynamic and rewarding health care environment. We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
 

 We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends and family as a phenomenal place to work! We value diversity in the work force and aim to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.
 


 Find out what it’s like to work here. Like us on Facebook(@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram(@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights!
 

 Detailed Overview: 
 
 Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:


   The Business Analyst provides leadership and support by applying expert knowledge in business intelligence, data analysis, data mining, and performance reporting to provide evidence-based review of service utilization, health interventions, technology assessments and performance analysis. The Business Analyst plans and develops reporting requirements by engaging with healthcare stakeholders across the organization, reviewing clinical, financial, human resource and operational data and by applying knowledge in performance measurement and benchmarking methodologies to develop BI analytical reports.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Collaborates with business units and stakeholders for identifying reporting needs, analyzing current procedures, identifying opportunities, reducing redundancies and ensuring reporting processes support business objectives.
 Works on and/or leads projects to improve dynamic reporting through report automation, and the adoption of emerging analytical methodologies, and BI tools and technologies.
 Develops interactive business intelligence reports and participates in the design, development and testing of performance reporting solutions using PowerBI.
 Conducts performance reporting benchmarking/best practices research and makes recommendations for improvement.
 Develops and seeks continuous improvement of performance reporting processes including developing performance reporting tools used to automate and coordinate report inputs, analyses and distribution.
 Ensures data is effectively gathered, mined and leveraged to support effective decision making in support of corporate strategies and provide quality assurance and a value-added review of reporting inputs to promote high standards for quality and insight.
 Prepares strategic business cases and supporting documents, briefing papers, strategic and tactical reports for an assigned area and/or portfolio for submission to Fraser Health Executive, Board of Directors and other stakeholders.
 Works collaboratively with members of the department, senior management, staff of various organizational units and other internal and external stakeholders in support of the mission, philosophies and goals of Fraser Health.
 Qualifications: 
 
 Education and Experience

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience in decision support, business analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Experience with T-SQL and PowerBI is preferred.
  

Skills and Abilities


 Demonstrates the LEADS capabilities of Leads Self, Engages Others, Achieves Results, Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation.
 

 Professional/Technical Capabilities


 Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the health care system
 Demonstrated ability to analyze clinical, administrative and financial data
 Demonstrated understanding of the relational multidimensional database concepts
 Knowledge of other health care disciplines and their role within healthcare
 Ability to operate related equipment including applicable software applications
 Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently
 Ability to plan, organizer and prioritize work and deadlines
 Working knowledge of healthcare analytics and statistics
 Working knowledge of PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma and other flow process improvement concepts
 Physical ability to perform the duties of the position

Title: Analyste de données/ Data Analyst
Research Data Analyst
Description:
Date Posted: 06/28/2022 Req ID: 24123 Faculty/Division: Faculty of Nursing Department: Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto) Position Number: 00038270

 Description:
 About us:  The University of Toronto’s Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing ranks among the premier nursing programs in the world and is a global leader in ground-breaking research and education.  Your opportunity:  The Research Data Analyst works as part of a team in the Research Office at the Lawrence S. Bloomberg Faculty of Nursing reporting to the Associate Dean Research. Responsibilities include: developing overall project design and research project protocols, participating in research project planning meetings, planning and coordinating data collection, managing administrative and survey data, conducting complex analyses in order to support the research initiatives of various Faculty members’ research projects, conducting critical appraisal of research literature, writing research summaries for reporting, writing grant proposals and manuscripts, ensuring study records are maintained, filed and stored appropriately, and providing input into overall Faculty research project goals. Other duties include providing methodological and analytic support to Principal Investigators, Co-Investigators, PhD Students and other team members in completion of their roles and providing work direction to Research Officers and/or other research assistant(s).  Your responsibilities will include:


 Developing overall project design
 Developing research project protocols
 Determining qualitative and/or quantitative research methods according toresearch objectives
 Overseeing the data collection and analysis processes
 Producing complex statistical information
 Analyzing results and preparing statistical reports for research papers
 Writing research summaries for reporting purposes
 Analyzing detailed statistical information to inform project direction


 Essential Qualifications:


 Master’s Degree in health sciences (nursing, medicine, psychology, etc.), public health, statistics or social sciences is required
 Minimum four (4) years of experience in research methodology and statistics
 Experience with data manipulation (e.g., coding for data entry, recording of variable for complex data, merging data), research design, data collection, and statistical analysis of databases
 Experience supervising staff
 Demonstrated experience in project planning and design using considerable judgment, initiative, and innovativeness
 Demonstrated experience in the writing and preparation of quantitative and/or qualitative manuscripts, presentations, reports, briefs and scientific abstracts for peer-reviewed journals
 Extensive computer skills with MS Office, data management and analysis (SAS, SPSS, Excel, Access), and presentation packages (Power Point)
 Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills
 Excellent written and oralcommunication skills
 Impeccable attention-to-detail and deadlines and the ability to work under pressure
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team

 Assets (Nonessential):


 Knowledge of Canadian/provincial health service databases and/or population health survey data

 To be successful in this role you will be:


 Articulate
 Assertive
 Multi-tasker
 Organized
 Problem solver
 Self-directed


 Notes: Please note that this is a term position from the date of hire until July 10, 2023.

 Closing Date: 07/11/2022, 11:59PM ET Employee Group: USW Appointment Type: Budget - Term Schedule: Full-Time Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone: USW Pay Band 16 - $90,424 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $115,638. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol. Job Category: Research Administration & Teaching Recruiter: Grace Joo
 Lived Experience Statement Candidates who are members of Indigenous, Black, racialized and 2SLGBTQ+ communities, person with disabilities, and other equity deserving groups are encourage to apply, and their lived experience shall be taken into consideration as applicable to the posted position.

Title: Senior Records and Information Management Analyst (Records Analyst 2)
Description:
Department: Natural Resources & Renewables
Location: HALIFAX
Type of Employment: Permanent
Union Status: NSGEU - NSPG
Closing Date: 7/6/2022 (Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)



 About Us




Nova Scotia is rich in natural resources – including biodiversity, forests, geological resources, provincial parks and the land we manage. The Department of Natural Resources and Renewables is responsible for the development, management, conservation and protection of forest, mineral, parks and wildlife resources and the administration of the province's Crown land. Together we are working with Nova Scotians to build a better future through sustainable natural resource management as we all benefit from the natural health and wealth of the province.


https://novascotia.ca/natr/




 About Our Opportunity




As the Senior Records and Information Management Analyst, you will be responsible for working with all branches of the Department, key stakeholders, other Departments, other Governments, and the public on records and information management requests, as well as related advice, privacy impact assessments, information sharing agreements, training, policy compliance, reporting and auditing




 Primary Accountabilities




Some of the primary accountabilities in the role include: 

Implementing and managing the records and information management program and working collaboratively with all branches in the Department to deliver the program in adherence with the Corporate Information Management Framework and the principles of accessibility, quality, optimizing value, accountability, integration, and protection. 
Managing data administration and analytics by maintaining the records databases, generating reports, identifying trends, and solving problems using data analytics. 
Consulting with and providing advice and training to staff respecting records and information and carrying out needs assessments to ensure all records and information management requirements are met. 
Examining and proposing information technology solutions that support the Department’s information and records needs and requirements, while respecting government policies, including coordinating cross-departmental records, researching various computer systems, software, and networks, and evaluating and facilitating database enhancements to improve search and retrieval services. 





Qualifications and Experience




Bachelor’s degree in a related field (such as records management, archives management, information management, or library science) along with 2 years of related experience. An equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered.


As the ideal candidate you have comprehensive knowledge of records management and records management programs such as STOR/STAR and similar programs. You have knowledge of information access and privacy legislation. Experience in using various computer applications including Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Access) as well as using STAR/STOR records classification or a similar records classification system, and disposition schedules. Sound knowledge of records management principles and terminology and related legislation in Nova Scotia is also required.


You also have experience identifying new or improved procedures, equipment, systems, and technologies. Previous experience approving and directing the management, recording, archiving, and destruction of records


You have strong relationship and communication skills to engage with various stakeholders internal and external to government. You also have exceptional attention to detail and time management skills.


We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.




 Equivalency




An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered; examples of equivalencies include: 

Completion of a 2-year diploma program along with 4 years of related experience. 


6 years of related experience.



Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.




 Benefits




Based on the employment status and Union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offering and eligibility criteria.




 Working Conditions




Work within an office environment. The job functions are generally performed in an air-conditioned workstation with ample lighting and equipment. Frequent interruptions while concentrating on database or other computer work may occur. Ability to review documents or files for hours is required.


On occasion, will be required to undertake work for short periods in an offsite; storage location which is not air conditioned, has limited heating, and no washroom facilities.


May have to lift or move records boxes weighing up to 45 pounds.


Occasional travel to regional/field offices as required. Driver’s licence is an asset.






What We Offer





Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Countless Career Paths for Nova Scotians.
Department Specific Flexible working schedules.






Pay Grade: PR 08
Salary Range: $1,955.09 - $2,396.86 Bi-Weekly


Employment Equity Statement:
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.


This is a bargaining unit position initially restricted to current civil service employees represented by the Nova Scotia Government Employees Union (NSGEU). If applying from outside a government office, employees must apply correctly via this link:


 
Failure to apply correctly means that your application will not be given first consideration as a bargaining unit applicant, and will only be included if external applications are pursued.


External applicants and current casual employees will only be considered if there are no qualified civil service bargaining unit candidates. PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will not be considered for an interview if applications are incomplete or are missing information.


Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Data Management Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 Reporting to the Manager of New Accounts North America, this position plays a key role in developing and executing upon the Client Management Group’s overall strategy and goals within Capital Markets.
 As part of wider Client Management function, this role is primarily responsible for supporting the Global Sales and Trading businesses in the coordination of opening, closing & maintaining trading and settlement accounts across the various product processing systems within Capital Markets.
 Supporting our data governance and quality controls, as well as actively participating in business and regulatory initiatives that have a significant impact to the firm and our clients. The role is aimed at developing an operational management of data, focused on improving efficiencies, reducing costs whilst also minimizing risk.  Working collaboratively with CMG partners, BCS, Risk, IT and Front office businesses partners throughout the bank, to understand their requirements and relevant business processes in order to deliver change and ultimately improve client service.

 What will you do?

 Maintain client and account level data in Capital Markets front and back office systems.
 Manage requests from multiple business areas; understand end to end process and trade flows.
 Be consistent, accurate and efficient in setting up, amending, cancelling and managing settlement instructions in the Front and Back Office system
 Ensure that all accounts are cross referenced into the supporting CMG repositories
 Use appropriate tools and exception management processes to ensure data quality.
 Management of data attributes related to regulatory data initiatives
 Proactively escalate issues as they arise and coordinate with the leadership team to ensure that we are able to manage expectations.
 Engagement with CMG globally regarding initiatives that relate to account management
 Review of CDR to source system reconciliations – perform root cause analysis
 Review of exception queues - perform root cause analysis

 Relationship Management 

Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and CMG alike.
 Strive to proactively seek out efficiencies in processes.
 Proactively escalate issues as they arise and coordinate with the leadership team to ensure that we are able to manage expectations.
 Optimize Account Management processes in order to reduce cycle time, manual effort and improve both end user experiences and realize cost savings.
 Linking multiple Functions and processes to a common source of data, reducing operational costs associated with maintaining multiple data silos through a single integrated reference point for trade processing and reporting.
 Maintain documentation outlining data lineage pertaining to all account related reference data in order to support the expansion of operational capabilities across Capital Markets, aiding in the prioritization of process and system enhancements.

 Projects

 Work closely with CMG management and supporting teams, providing input on all initiatives impacting reference data applications and/or expansion of reference data consumption by downstream users in order to meet ongoing and evolving business, risk, and regulatory requirements.
 Support delivery of data remediation activities, finding innovative ways to both remediate and implement stronger data quality controls around data environments
 Develop and oversee data quality reporting and ensure senior management is informed of data quality issues and operational risks that are identified as impactful to downstream processes or the business operations.
 Maintain documentation outlining data lineage pertaining to all account related reference data in order to support the expansion of operational capabilities across Capital Markets, aiding in the prioritization of process and system enhancements.
 Act as a subject matter expert on CMG projects.


 What you need to succeed?

 Bachelor’s degree
 1 – 2 years of prior related experience.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Excellent team working capabilities.
 Ability to network and build strong relationships.
 Working knowledge of SSIs
 Ability to multi-task and quickly adapt to new processes
 Ability to be flexible, innovative, organized
 Firm understanding of how Capital Markets operates and familiarity with traditional Capital Markets product offerings.
 Previous experience of party data management in trading and settlement systems
 Experience of working in a data management function within an Investment Bank.
 Strong ability to prioritize under both normal and pressure situations
 MS Office - should be highly proficient, primarily in the use of Excel and Access

 Nice-to-have

 Working Knowledge of Sequel and SQL.
 Working knowledge of regulatory reporting


 What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Flexible work/life balance options







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-NS-BEDFORD
 




































 Country:




































 Canada
 




































 Work hours/week:




































 37.5
 




































 Employment Type:




































 Full time
 




































 Platform:




































 Capital Markets
 




































 Job Type:




































 Regular
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-06-28-07:00
 




































 Application Deadline:




































 2022-07-12-07:00
 







































































 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.













































































































 Join our Talent Community  Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
 Ziff Davis is looking for a natural problem solver with a strong interest in fulfilling the business' expanding appetite for data, and helping define our data analytics roadmap. This role will be involved in all parts of the Business Intelligence process, from data acquisition to final presentation. The analyst will develop reports and self-service tools for internal customers via Domo from data housed in log files, Vertica, MySQL, SQL Server, and Redshift databases, S3 Buckets, Redshift, and 3rd party API integrations, and MS SQL Server databases to serve both internal and external customers.
 Responsibilities

 Act as the subject matter expert for accessing and analyzing diverse, unstructured data across the Ziff Davis product platforms using combinations of analytic software, especially Domo and Pendo.
 Utilize business intelligence expertise, business knowledge and technical skills to successfully deliver solutions that help solve business challenges.
 Work cross-functionally with Data Engineering, Product, Marketing and Sales leadership to define the business requirements for data collection, analysis and infrastructure needs.
 Provide direction, expertise, and end-user training oriented toward self-service reporting portals.
 Assess the impact of production system changes to the existing analytics and implement changes to data warehouse ETL and reporting code to ensure consistent and accurate reporting.
 Analyze, design, and test BI front-end deployment and back-end ETL processes according to user requirements.
 Document technical standards, build and maintain a comprehensive data dictionary.

 Requirements:

 5+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence/Reporting Analyst role.
 3+ years of knowledge and experience using database systems, SQL, and ETL tools, especially Segment and Pentaho.
 3+ years of experience deploying data visualizations into BI solutions, especially Domo.
 Experience in analysis and reporting with large, complex data structures.
 Ability to manage data from multiple data sources including varying database platforms, log files, Google Analytics, S3 Buckets, Salesforce, and API endpoints.
 Experience working with structured and unstructured data from various sources and formats.
 Passion and interest in Business Intelligence, Dashboards, Reports, Data-modeling, Data Warehouses, ETL Processes and Data-Integration.
 Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills with ability to communicate ideas and solutions to non-technical users
 Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive customer and internal information.
 Highly self-motivated and directed with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
 Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative, and remote environment.

 Preferred Skills:

 Experience with R, Python, or other data analysis languages
 Exposure to Kanban and JIRA
 Prior or current experience working within a SAAS environment
 Professional experience using managed cloud services (AWS)
