Title: Product Operations Analyst
Description:
About Q4


   At Q4, we hustle, we grind and we grow. As the team members that make up #Q4orce, we care, we compete and we support each other every day. We’re on a mission to deliver a best-in-class client experience driven by technology, data, and of course, our people.
 


 As the leading provider of website, analytics and virtual events solutions to investor relations and the capital markets, Q4 is a trusted partner to over 2,700 of the world’s most successful public companies and institutions – and we are growing at an incredible pace. We’re on our way to becoming the largest capital markets platform company in the world. That’s where you come in.
 


 We hire smart, curious, and talented people to push boundaries, reimagine what’s possible and turn challenges into opportunities, all while keeping the needs of our clients at the heart of everything we do.
 


 Come grow with us!
 


 The Gig 


  Q4 is looking for an energetic, self-directed with a business mindset, Senior Data Analyst on the Product Operations team. You will help generate data insights to help product teams and business stakeholders across the organization to make data-informed decisions in the way we lead and grow our business.
 


 Exceptional analytical, adaptability, communication, and business skills are vital for success in this role. The role is ideal for an individual who is driven by an obsessive desire to understand “why”, has willingness to learn, and is passionate about driving product and business value. You must be comfortable working with large or incomplete data sets to uncover new insights, tell a story through data, and be able to think critically to develop solutions to complex problems.
 
 Key Responsibilities:

 Communicate product health, experiment results, opportunities to product and business teams via dashboards and reports that are easily digestible by stakeholders at various levels of the organization
 Build, cleanse and maintain a scalable source of truth for a 360 view of our product health, collecting product usage, financial, customer and operational data from disparate sources and stakeholders
 Collaborate with product management, sales, customer success, finance and business operations to establish instrumentation and measurements around product performance against KPIs
 Lead the product understanding process using data to identify opportunities to remove friction and accelerate growth and market adoption of our products
 Bring a deep understanding of growth & optimization best practices.
 Synthesize large data sets into digestible insights
 Partner with engineering and operational stakeholders to define logging requirements for net-new datasets

 Skills and Experiences Required:

 3 - 4 years of experience performing quantitative analysis in a business and product facing capacity (e.g. making financial models, correlating disparate data, cleaning databases)
 2 - 3 years experience working collaboratively with product team members such as: product management, engineering, design, data science, data engineering etc.
 Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into actionable insights
 Entrepreneurial mindset to deliver impact in ambiguous environments, navigate through complexity and manage change
 Advanced communication, influencing, relationship and team building skills
 Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM systems
 Experience with Pendo, Google Analytics and comparable product analytics tools
 Experience with BI tools such as SiSense and Tableau
 Working knowledge of SQL


 Why Q4? 


  We are motivated by solving complex problems in unorthodox ways. Emphasis on your well-being means you experience your true potential. We offer a variety of benefits to ensure you can always work hard and have fun:
 


 Health, wellness and lifestyle benefits to balance your heart, mind, and body.
Pension matching and Employee Equity Incentives to support your financial health.
Unlimited paid time off so you can really recharge and enjoy life.
Flexible working environment. Choose your home, one of our trendy offices or mix it up.
Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is important.
And an amazing culture to top it all off!




 Join #Q4orce


   Q4’s diverse and inclusive workplace fosters a friendly, open-minded environment. Diversity makes us stronger from the increased pace of innovation to strengthening our culture. With great reasons to work here, take advantage by submitting your application to join our growing team.
  




  Q4 values diversity and people of all backgrounds and abilities. Should you require any accommodations prior to or during the interview process, please contact hr@q4inc.com. 
 

  #LI-Remote

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description:
Meltwater is looking for Data and Content Analysts to join our Enterprise team in Toronto !
 Are you an insatiable reader? Are you constantly staying on top of current events? Do you have experience working with digital content? Meltwater is seeking committed and detail-oriented individuals with a passion for business information and analytics to join our North America Enterprise team. As an Enterprise Marketing Analyst you will work closely with with the global marketing team using Meltwater’s web-based news and social media solutions to review, analyze, and provide insights on trending topics and industry trends to be used in content, such as insight reports and infographics, and to support media pitches.
 The position will be part of the global marketing team and the US Enterprise team, which works with Meltwater’s biggest clients across North America.
 The role is both challenging and rewarding. The right candidate will be learning a wealth of knowledge about industry-leading clients, data analytics, excel, power point, and how to extract and report the right kind of insights to Meltwater's global marketing team.
 Individuals should be detail oriented, hardworking, enthusiastic, and motivated. Training will be provided to high potential candidates. 



Research and gain a working knowledge of the global marketing content calendar and key industries, as well as on-going industry and policy news 
Be part of the Analytics team, providing support and reporting for Meltwater’s global marketing team, as well as various client projects and leveraging Meltwater’s proprietary software platforms 
Become an expert user on in-house SaaS platforms 
Assist team with senior management research requests 
Help senior management research and develop pitches for new clients 
Build Boolean Logic searches and basic analytics, set-up new users, update client cards, etc. (if you are not familiar with Boolean no worries, we will provide training on this) 
Create reports by mining digital media and social media content based on based on the parameters set by the global content team. 
Analyze data streams from multiple media channels to measure topics, industries, etc etc to support marketing content development. 



Why Meltwater?
 Meltwater has gone from humble beginnings in Oslo, Norway in 2001 to the global leader in media intelligence with 30,000 global clients today. We provide solutions to help modern PR, communication, and marketing professionals better understand their current media landscape, both in the news & social media. 
For almost 20 years, Meltwater has maintained a very unique culture based on a foundation and belief in people and the potential they possess, regardless of experience. Our motto? When you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. There are 2,000 members of the Meltwater family residing in 55 offices across 25 countries around the world. No matter what office you’re in, you’ll be surrounded by the best colleagues you’ve ever had. 
Meltwater employees embody the work-hard, play-hard spirit through our 3 core values- Moro (fun), Enere (number one) and Respect (Respect). These founding principles stem from our Norweigan roots and are why Meltwater has been named a Great Place to Work in several markets across the globe. We have high energy, open concept offices that focus on teamwork and collaboration. We ensure our employees have easy access to management and learn quickly from those around them. 
At Meltwater, the average isn’t good enough. Our goal is to build a groundbreaking company supported by a thriving culture in which our people aspire to exceed their personal expectations. We only promote our sales leadership team from within the company, and our goal is to facilitate your long-term professional growth. 
Our work is fun, challenging and rewarding, and we’re looking for driven individuals, passionate about learning business by doing it. 
Equal Opportunity
 Meltwater is firmly committed to affording equal employment opportunities to all candidates and employees alike without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, marital status disability, veteran status and we treat each individual with respect and dignity. 
The “EEO is the Law” poster is available at: http://bit.ly/2KBm9Ei
 And “EEO is the Law Supplement” poster is available at: http://bit.ly/2Kmxnxd
 On-Line Accessibility Directive: If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us here for assistance.

Title: Incentive Analyst
Description:
Title: Incentive Analyst
 Location: London, Ontario, Canada
 Reports To: Supervisor, Incentive
 The Role:
 The Incentive Analyst is an entry level position and is responsible for assisting in the development, design and implementation of customized incentives and spending reports for Autodata' s clients.
 Responsibilities:

Learn and understand incentive marketing programs in the Automotive Industry through training and self-directed research
Triage, analyze and interpret incentive programs and enter data into custom business systems
Provide quality control support for incentive data
Assist and lend content knowledge support to other departments through product testing and consulting

Post-secondary education in a related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Automotive industry experience is an asset
Superior communication, analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Exceptionally self-motivated, directed, and detail-oriented
Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously
Ability to manage and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams
Excellent understanding of project management principles
Excellent MS Office skills



 J.D. Power is a global leader in consumer insights, data, analytics, and advisory services that helps clients drive growth and profitability. The company's industry benchmarks and reputation for independence and integrity have established it as one of the world's most well-known and trusted brands.


 J.D. Power's recruitment efforts are aligned with the company's commitment to provide opportunities rooted in diversity, inclusion, and equality.
 Our Vision: To be the leader in providing advanced data solutions that empower industry transformation.
 Our Mission: We unite industry leading data and insights with world-class technology to solve our clients' toughest challenges.
 Our Values: We are Truth Finders, Change Makers and Team Driven.
 We are dedicated to leveraging comprehensive and equitable practices which contribute to the overall success of the company and its employees. We invite you to learn more about our DE&I efforts.


 J.D. Power is an equal opportunity employer and compliant with AODA/ADA legislation. If you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please specify.
 To all recruitment agencies: J.D. Power does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Business Analyst/ Business System Analyst
Description:
CPQi provides consultative services and expertise to help our clientele in the financial industry deliver better services to their users, speed up development lifecycles and bring them into a digital age. We work with 8 of the world's top 12 banks, exposing our team to the most exciting technologies and strategies in today's digital era. You will be working on various projects supporting our clients and we want you to grow with us. In doing that we focus heavily on the progress and education of all of our team members. That's why we invest in you by offering CPQi University, paid certifications and other training programs. We want to build a career for life here at CPQi.
We are currently seeking a Business Analyst/Business Systems Analyst to join our team!
Responsibilities:

Understanding business interdependencies and demonstrating critical thinking that identifies risks and establishing effective risk mitigation from the outset.
Demonstrating stakeholder partnership involving effective communication with project sponsor, SME; gaining and building trust and rapport.
Participating in data analysis across different lines of business under Capital Markets.
Transforming business requirements and research into winning delivery solutions meeting the performance goal.
Conducting key stakeholder, SME meetings to understand current state of business and provide solutions and scope for automation
Prepare key findings document for business and their partners (Risk, Compliance, Operations, Governance, Trading),
Researching/Analyzing issues, defining opportunities for business process improvements and making recommendations within scope.
Prepared end to end process flow maps (Visio) for different products within Equity Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets & Leverage Finance (From winning the deal to Ticketing & Revenue distribution).
Preparing GAP Analysis on tools being used across Capital markets and providing recommendation for better use where required.
Prepare minutes for each stakeholder meeting to document key information required for recommendation and solutions.
Preparing weekly presentation on project status updates and project delivery presentation regarding key findings, opportunities and recommendation.

 Skills

Strong experience meeting with clients and users
 Proven experience building and maintaining client relationships

 Must Have

 Strong experience in Capital Market OR Banking OR Financial Services

Title: Business Development Associate, External Development Intelligence (XDI)
Description:
Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.
XDI's purpose is to accelerate development by identifying the world's best external partners, ensuring successful engagements, and sharing industry knowledge.
As part of EA Create, we search the globe for trusted and talented external partners to work with EA Studio game teams and central technology teams. We are a central team that owns EA’s due diligence evaluation process and risk management process. We support multiple disciplines, including co-dev, porting, art, animation, cinematics, UX-UI, engineering, and audio.
Key Responsibilities:

Partner evaluations and due diligence reporting using XDI’s risk management framework.
Supporting strategic partner portfolio management including regular check-ins and on-site assessments with established partners to ensure ongoing trust and viability.
As a key partner in EA’s Game Development Framework we support a portfolio of internal game teams and central tech teams by consulting on external development strategy, recommending partners, providing partner risk assessments, and occasionally helping with issue resolution.
Collaboration with a broad cross section of central teams including Legal, Security, Audit, Global Strategic Sourcing, Finance, Compliance, and other central roles to ensure clear process and program management of EA’s requirements for working with external partners.

Team Related:

The XDI team works in a mostly distributed fashion. We have members in Redwood Shores (California), Stockholm (Sweden), Vancouver (British Columbia), Orlando (Florida) and Shanghai (China)
We interface with team members and partners around the globe. Our work is primarily conducted using Zoom, email, Slack, and project management tools.
Early morning or evening calls and travel (when possible) are a reality for this role as we interface with global partners and teams. That said, our team is encouraged to strive for work life balance and to proactively manage capacity in a way that supports this goal.
Candidates with a strong preference for an in-person team dynamic may not thrive in this role as much communication and collaboration is now done remotely.
Our team members know that our team doesn’t start and stop with XDI. It’s important to expand our network (both within EA and externally).
Our team members are self-directed with an ability to quickly surface the right information at the right time to those who need it.

Business Partnerships:

XDI manages EA’s Strategic Partner portfolio. As an associate, you will be a supporting point of contact for a subset of this portfolio. You will assist in evaluating development and operational risks, issue resolution, and have a high degree of integrity when it comes to conducting oneself with outside key partners.
You will share critical knowledge about our partners with XDI, other Business Development groups, and teams across the company to ensure those working with our partners access the information they need to make key decisions.

Experience & Capabilities:

Our team strikes a fine balance between advocacy for our partners, both internal and external, and conducting risk evaluations to ensure EA’s IP is protected. Candidates have to be able to do both.
Ability to think and act globally. We interact with EA teams and external partners from all over the globe. We expect our team members to conduct themselves with high integrity and embrace cultural differences, value diverse opinions, and do their part to promote an inclusive development environment.
Demonstrated business acumen: this role requires objective decision making, and excellent collaboration ability with diverse teams and partners.
Lifelong learner who is inquisitive and enjoys knowledge acquisition as much as knowledge sharing. Should have a degree of comfort with public speaking, delivering presentations/panels, and facilitating brainstorming sessions.
Game development experience is highly desirable.
Experience in centralized departments such as studio operations, publishing, licensing, program management, business development are highly transferable for this role.
You will be expected to travel on-site to visit your partners on occasion and while often you will travel with other XDI team members or EA game team members there are times you will be asked to travel alone. Must have a degree of comfort with business travel and everything that comes with it (expense reports, airports, time zone changes, etc). On average, XDI team members do one international trip (1 week+/- duration) and 2-3 short domestic trips a quarter.

XDI Team Values:

Collaborative team players.
Ethical, fair, objective decision makers.
Support and solution focused.
Think and act globally.
Work life balance is key to our success.
Self-directed with inner drive.
When the going gets tough, the tough get going!
Influence without ego.
Passion and enthusiasm.

Reporting:
This role reports to a Manager of External Development Intelligence, as part of the EA Create organization.


 Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

Title: Business Process Analyst
Description:
Level of position: Professional (P2)
 


 Position Purpose:



 The purpose of this position is to support the enterprise-wide management of business processes through mapping, conducting the detailed examination and interpretation of data to gain insight and drive business planning and re-engineering for business units and operating divisions to run lean and efficiently. It will also support the design, development, maintenance, and continual improvement of a Quality Management System Framework as well as continuous improvement, process optimization and quality management initiatives relating to overall delivery of IO’s Capital Program.
 
 What You Will Do:

 Assess client needs through facilitation of problem identification and scope creation
 Support clients through business process mapping, design and performing end-to-end analyses, and running scenarios modelled to optimize process performance
 Support clients in identifying process gaps, analyzing options, implementing improvement solutions, and work with various operating divisions to automate processes where appropriate
 Develop performance metrics and conduct performance monitoring to inform continual optimization. Contribute to the processes and activities to meet functional and organizational KPIs
 Maintain and make accessible all processes in a centralized resource repository and track the evolution of processes in standardized documentation change logs
 Identify gaps and influence the development or enhancement of quality assurance components such as processes, performance and monitoring tools, training materials, and programs
 Coordinate and manage the standardization of quality assurance component templates (e.g. user needs assessment, work guides, roles and responsibility matrices)
 Manage continual improvement of Quality Management Systems, including holding regular performance reviews with client groups and overseeing implementation of action plans
 Provide strategic advice and education to client groups on quality management, process optimization, client needs assessment, and continuous improvement
 Provide instruction on quality methodologies and educate client groups on how to define, measure, and improve the quality of their products and processes
 Implement and maintain quality frameworks and optimization of business processes within IO’s operating divisions in close partnership with the relevant IO business units
 Develop systems and controls to increase the consistency of project and process outcomes, including the organization of lessons learned workshops in conjunction with business units
 Manage maintenance and delivery of quality management frameworks within IO’s business units and the carrying out of root cause analyses following failures or errors identified in quality control exercises or as part of ongoing continuous improvement
 Project manage priority continuous improvement initiatives within IO’s operating divisions in a manner that is fully embedded and in partnership with applicable functional groups

 Who We’re Looking For:

 A few years experience working in a matrix environment with process owners assisting with the detailed examination and interpretation of findings and mapping of workflows; demonstrate knowledge of the concepts of Lean and continuous improvement and have past experience of analyzing root cause and recommending improvements; experience within continuous/process improvement teams, either as core function or as a secondary role
 Demonstrate knowledge of Project Management concepts and methodologies
 Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is required
 Project Management Professional (PMP) or Project Management Certificate (PMC) would be considered an asset
 Certified Quality Process Analyst (CQPA) would be considered an asset.
 Business Process Management Professional (BPMP) or Business Process Management Certificate (BPMC) would be considered an asset


   The salary range for this position is $58,300 - $87,435, with a corresponding job level of P2.
 

   Closing date: 
  Thursday, July 7, 2022.
 

   Please note that interviews will occur on a rolling basis until the role is filled.
 


 At Infrastructure Ontario, we strive to create a culture that encourages a diverse equitable and inclusive environment that fosters belonging. We believe that experience comes in many forms and through learning from each others’ differences and perspectives gives us strength. We are committed to enhancing our culture and encourage applications from all walks of life. Let us know if you require any accommodations for the selection process, by contacting the Talent Acquisition Team.
 


 By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, Mining Tire Group (MTG)
 Are you looking for an opportunity to support a team guiding meaningful and exciting change?
 As a data analyst in our mining division, you have the responsibility to own our operational data model and be a part of the future of mining with an organization driven by values and innovation.
 In this role, you’ll support our Business Insights team in influencing developments that improve sustainability, safety, and productivity at 150+ mine sites across five continents. If you get excited about providing reliable solutions and managing version control processes, this is a great role for an emerging data analyst ready for the next stage in your career. This role is also flexible to be remote within Canada.
 The ideal candidate is an individual who is keen to develop and share new ideas, has strong attention to detail, and who possesses demonstrated interpersonal and collaborative skills. If this sounds like you, this may be the right opportunity to jumpstart your career.  CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
 Reporting and Analysis

 Understand, monitor, and escalate data quality issues.
 Develop and maintain a data catalogue tool (when available) that enables effective measure definition. 

Troubleshooting, Application Support and Maintenance

 Ensure the model refreshes smoothly and data updates into the model daily from source systems. Troubleshoot and resolve issues as needed.
 Ensure the model includes the available safeguards to prevent customer data being visible to other customers. 
Provide support to consultants to help them understand Kal Tire table structures and code.
 Provide technical support including incident response, troubleshooting, root cause analysis and resolution for internal and external clients

 Operational Excellence/Continuous Improvement

 Ownership of the MTG operational data model. Supports model design, relationships and measures work to ensure an acceptable user experience and controlled processing costs.
 Continue to seek opportunities to evolve the model and code using optimization tools.

 Testing and Change Management

 Ensure all models align with business standards, data governance and architecture.
 Implement changes, enhancements, and upgrades to models and reports as required.
 Run testing and quality assurance activities on MTG models and reports.
 Provide technical support including incident response, troubleshooting, root cause analysis and resolution for internal and external clients

 WORK EXPERIENCE

 Data engineering: Strong knowledge of building, deploying, and maintaining relationship model structures. Familiarity with tools such as Azure Data Lake and Synapse is considered an asset.
 Data analytics: 3-5 years’ experience as a Data Analyst supporting reporting and analytics specifically using BI visualization tools.

 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

 Strong data engineering or ETL skills. The ability to gather, manipulate and transform data for use in reporting and research models.
 Demonstrated knowledge and application of CI/CD or version control tools.
 Demonstrated knowledge of building, deploying, and maintaining multi-relational models.
 Strong programming knowledge. Practical knowledge of Python/Scala, SQL and DAX is considered an asset.
 Experience with Azure Data Platform including Data Lake, and PowerBI.
 Practical knowledge of tools such as Databricks, Synapse, Tabular Editor, and Dax Studio.
 Experience building visualizations, dashboards, and interactive reports.
 Ability to manage time effectively.
 Ability to prioritize multiple assignments simultaneously. Must have strong organizational skills.
 Strong interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to build productive, sustainable, and collaborative working relationships with clients, management, and colleagues.
 Command of the English language, both oral and written.

 EDUCATION

 Degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience.

 SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

 Occasional evening and weekend work as required.

 About Kal Tire
 It’s an exciting time in the mining industry and at Kal Tire’s Mining Tire Group, an international leader in mining tire management and supply. As mines move toward automation and operating in way that’s more sustainable, we’ve developed solutions such as a thermal conversion recycling facility in Chile, award-winning tire management tools that protect front-line technicians, and advanced tire life offerings that keep tires out of scrap piles and in production.
 It’s with this commitment to doing what’s right that we also enrich lives in the communities we serve, giving back to schools, families, and social agencies on the ground. Our team members regularly have the chance to participate in social responsibility projects.
 At Kal Tire, we say ‘team’ and ‘team members’ because that’s what we do: collaborate to share our expertise and help customers solve some of their most pressing mining tire challenges. We’re proud to be a welcoming organization and an equal opportunity employer that fosters fulfilling careers for all.
 This is your opportunity to start building a lasting and successful career with Kal Tire. Discover the Kal Tire difference today by applying to join our growing and dynamic team of more than 6500 team members worldwide!

Title: Lab Clinical Data Analyst
Description:
Essential Functions


Manage delivery of projects through full data management study life-cycle with guidance from a more senior Laboratory Data Analyst or Manager, manage project timelines and quality; identify out-of-scope work. Serve as a Primary Laboratory Data Analyst for a number of regional or global studies. Bring project solutions to the LDM team.
Interact with internal and external team members to negotiate timelines and responsibilities and to help resolve issues dealing with clinical trials database.
Ensure service and quality meet agreed upon timelines and deliverables in data transmission agreements; ensure quality checks performed on data files before transmission and obtain peer-review where required.
Determine and assist with set up data requirements and specifications per project needs as requested by the Client Data Manage; identify database set up and programming gaps and solves issues using the global issue escalation/communication policy.
Ensure specification and design documentation are filed and stored according to company policy.
Understand and verify error logs generated by the LIQVIA Data Transmission creation programs and communicate to the programming/support team to resolve any issues in the data transmission (with guidance).
Record all evidence of the data transmission process from data file definition to closure of study.
Ensure the internal and external customer queries are addressed and resolved effectively.
Perform comprehensive quality control procedures to maintain the completeness, accuracy and consistency of the clinical trial database deliverables on an ongoing basis.
Uses multiple approaches or technologies to solve a problem within established standards and procedures.
Provide input for negotiations with customer relative to project details, e.g., timelines, financial, process, resources.
Perform other duties as directed by the functional manager.
Work performed is in accordance with ICH E6 Guideline for Good Clinical Practice




 Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree Computer, life sciences or a related field Required
1 year of relevant work experience including programming experience Required
Combination of computing qualification and professional experience Required
Equivalent combination of education, training and experience Required
Experience with SAS programming in the course of file format process
Good customer-focus perspective with skill to guide customer communications and customer management Beginner
Good attention to detail to anticipate, address and/or escalate issues, with aptitude to embrace and be conduit for change Intermediate
Good project and task management capabilities and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously Beginner
Effective problem solving skills as well as ability to proactively identifying process improvements which reduce operational costs and maintain quality Beginner
Quality conscious with high degree of ethics and integrity carrying out duties in accordance to laws, regulatory standards, and with company policies and procedures Intermediate
Proficiency in Windows operating systems (user-level skills), Microsoft Office applications Beginner
Good understanding of medical, clinical research, and Lab Data Management process and terminology Beginner
Working knowledge on various regulatory requirements such as FDA, ICH, ISO HL7, and GLP (Good Laboratory Practices) Beginner



 Q² Solutions is a leading clinical trial laboratory services organization with end-to-end laboratory services and secure, enterprise-wide biospecimen and consent management solutions. https://q2labsolutions.com/careers

Title: Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 152957  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Why work for Scotiabank?
 Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.
 This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!  Global Banking and Markets
 Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

 Purpose

 The trade confirmation process performed by Global Wholesale Operations (GWO) is a key control within Scotiabank’s Global Banking and Markets (GBM) trading environment.
 Contributes to the overall success of the OTC Confirmations Department, supporting Global Banking and Markets (GBM) and Group Treasury (GT) globally, ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 Accountabilities


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge:
   
 Understand customer needs, and maintain customer service standards
 Develop and maintain relationships with customers at the operations staff levels, allowing for effective communications and issue resolution
 Ensure customer issues are identified, reported, escalated, and resolved




 Ensure risk inherent in the trade confirmation process is identified, understood, and controlled:
   
 Draft or review counterparty trade confirmations in accordance with Bank policy
 Escalate and resolve operational issues
 Participate in the investigation of issues, recommending measures to prevent recurrence
 Ensure the Bank is reconciled with external electronic trade execution and affirmation/confirmation platforms and Central Counterparty Clearing Houses
 Negotiate confirmations with Trade Counterparties
 Train existing and new staff on covered workstations




 Contribute to change initiatives:
   
 Identify opportunities and/or contribute to the implementation of improvement in controls, customer service, and productivity
 Interact with Management to provide operational input and recommendations


 

Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct
 Champions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team
 Support the Bank’s goals and initiatives, and perform all work assigned by management


 Requirements


 Expert knowledge of OTC Confirmations for several products (Equity and FX Option Derivatives preferred)
 Passion for customer service
 Driven to improve efficiency and controls
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
 Accurate and detail oriented with an analytical mind and the ability to detect, articulate, and effectively escalate and resolve issues
 Strong computer, data analytics, and process re-engineering skills


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
Strathcona Resources Ltd. (“Strathcona”) is a Calgary, Alberta based crude oil and gas production and development company focused on maximizing oil and gas recovery from its low decline, high free cash flow oil and gas resource base. Strathcona's operations, infrastructure and land position are focused in British Columbia, Alberta and Saskatchewan.
Strathcona Resources is presently seeking an ESG Data Analyst for a six-month contract position in our Calgary office. Reporting to the ESG and Sustainability Advisor, the successful candidate will ensure smooth ESG data integration which includes compiling data from different teams (finance, production, HSE, etc.) to produce a fulsome picture of the company's performance. The Data Analyst will use problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies and implement technology solutions.


The Successful Candidate Will:

Prepare and maintain data and dashboards that will be used for internal and external reporting and drive progress towards the company’s ESG goals by informing company strategy and target setting
Learn the databases for data storage and collection for various systems and software to provide a consistent, seamless "source of truth" in ESG data
Recommend best practices and proactive measures to make scope changes (e.g., M&A) easier to integrate by having a consistent framework for new data
Implementing QA/QC processes for ESG data, including working with third-party providers to obtain assurance over ESG data prior to external reporting
Supporting the continuous improvement of ESG disclosure, including alignment with leading frameworks (SASB, TCFD, or similar)
Participate in the development of Strathcona’s annual integrated report, including non-financial content, sustainability targets, sustainability performance table, third-party assurance and any other required information


 
Qualifications Include:

Excellent writing and verbal communication skills with a knowledge of Microsoft products and other collaboration tools
Experience in data analytics and/or database development
Exceptional information processing with high levels of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to aggregate and assimilate significant amounts of data; problem-solving mindset along with experience in analysis to support decision making
Lead and engage in complex quantitative analysis to support clear understanding of potential development opportunities and policies


 
Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in STEM (Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Mathematics) discipline, or a related quantitative discipline is preferred and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Familiar with ESG reporting frameworks (SASB, GRI, TCFD) is preferred. 
Energy / oil and gas experience is an asset
Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, R+ etc.) and data structures is required
Computer skills required: Microsoft suite, BI tools/analytical and visualization platforms (e.g., Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau)


 
Great things aren’t done by one person, they’re done by a team.
Strathcona is committed to developing a high-performance culture through collaboration, trust, and agility. We value our work, our communities, and our commitments – but most of all, we value the team of people who make what we do possible.

 Apply to Strathcona
If you have what it takes to be a great Strathcona team member, we want to hear from you. We appreciate all interest in this opportunity but only those selected to advance through the process will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Brandt has a position available for a Data Analyst in our Regina, SK location. The ideal candidate will obtain advanced knowledge in all areas of the Distributed and Manufactured Products Divisions working closely with vendors, developers and business users. Ensure all Software products deployed have appropriate training materials developed. Ensure all business processes conducted using the deployed software are documented including all associated reports, data inputs and outputs. Work with the business and the supplier of the software to ensure that any proposed business process changes are not detrimental to the overall system or other areas of the user community. Be instrumental in testing with business end users and new features and functions as well as any changes prior to deploying in a production environment.

Work with the business end users and business process owners to ensure the systems are performing their intended role at Brandt.
Create, implement, and maintain master data management solutions.
Coordinate master data management efforts across the organization.
Ensure all changes to the systems deployed are documented.
Ensure all business processes are properly documented.
Ensures end user training materials are current and available.
Work collaboratively with all other IT disciplines at Brandt.
Ensure that all work artifacts are properly documented, and documentation is maintained.
Other duties as required.


 Required Skills
 
 Required Experience
 

Minimum of 5 years experience with deployed software or 5 years experience supporting software applications
Experience with Master Data Management tools & techniques
Experience with Business Systems such as CRM, ERP, or SCM
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM is an asset
Working knowledge of requirements gathering, facilitation, testing of software processes
Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure Analytics is an asset
Understanding of relational databases, ELT/ETL tools is an asset
Be able to provide exceptional customer service to the end user community
Previous experience working on or participating in an IT Systems Project is an asset

Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose: The Logistics Analyst has primary responsibility for on-demand analytics (including data mining), providing business recommendations (and support), and leading cross-functional projects. They lead to scope problems/ opportunities, develop potential solutions and reach consensus on the path forward. Projects range from inventory optimization, to cost savings, to process improvement, to supplier management to field execution.

 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & ACTIVITIES:

 Budgeting: prepare, track and manage a budget for the logistics areas of responsibility by conducting analysis & preparing data to support requested budget; ensure compliance of budgeting for logistics teams by validating invoices relating to logistics, live haul and finished goods; monitor the financial performance of area of responsibility against approved budget so that areas of unsatisfactory performance are identified; and yearly freight tender responsibility.
 Project Management: achieves operational objectives by contributing information and recommendations to strategic plans and reviews; preparing and completing action plans; Implementing productivity, customer-service standards; resolving problems; completing audits; identifying trends; determining system improvements; implementing change; with leadership team, set and monitor targets based on a developed, actionable plan; define action require when results are off target; and provide analysis, strategic planning processes to Leadership Team.
 Technology Lead: evaluate future needs as it pertains to application, hardware, communication, professional services, and maintenance; develop a technology strategy based on the findings of future needs, best practices and available technology to modernize use of technology in order to improve service and work more efficiently; and provide professional expertise and advice as it pertains to technology.
 Data Analytics: in collaboration with stakeholders, take lead role to implement data analytics supported by reports and dashboards are required; create processes and methods to gather logistics; run detailed spreadsheets in EXCEL; understand implications of network models; understand use of optimization tools; and score card management.
 Logistics Optimization: evaluate vendor operations (e.g. freight forwarders) according to quality standards; track KPIs and report on supply chain’s performance; define action require when results are off target; and collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems.
 Policies, Processes & Procedures: adhere/comply with company policies and procedures.


 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

 One to three years of working experience required;
 Good understanding of supply chain fundamentals and the ability to embed best practices into the daily operations;
 Experience with data mining and analysis techniques;
 Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting;
 Experience with supply chain processes (e.g., inventory planning, warehouse management);
 Strong quantitative analytical skills, business acumen and insight; with the ability to understand and synthesize data from various sources, work around data limitations, and form impactful judgments and insights;
 Desire to -roll up your sleeves - disaggregate complex problems and simplify into executable solutions;
 Working knowledge of MS Office, relational databases and ERP systems (e.g. NAV).


 EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

 Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Analytics, Mathematics or related field required.
 CLT (Canadian Livestock Transport) certification is an asset.


 COMPETENCIES:

 Building Trust - Builds strong relationships on a foundation of trust, loyalty and authenticity.
 Driving for Results - Relentlessly pursues quantifiable and measurable results: identifies areas for improvement and executes changes as necessary.
 Communication & Listening - Encourages open and honest communication with the team, communicates messages clearly and concisely and listens attentively to others.
 Initiative - Proactively seeks new opportunities and challenges; takes ownership and accountability for enhancing results or minimizing problems.
 Builds Networks - Builds strong relationships with peers, partners and key stakeholders, cultivating meaningful connections.
 Awareness & Insight - Assesses one’s own abilities, understands how actions impact perceptions and thrives within our culture, climate and organization at all levels.


 WORKING CONDITION: Office based

 In accordance with Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.

 We thank all applicants for applying however only those chosen will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Us
Wireless DNA is an authorized exclusive Rogers and Fido dealer with over 20 years in the industry with an award-winning network of stores to bring the best and the latest in telecommunication technology. We have 27 different locations across the Greater Toronto area, including one at the Toronto Pearson airport.
We are passionate about innovation and believe that the best road to success lies through growth and happiness of our employees.
About This Role
The individual will be responsible for the management and optimization of BI Systems with data management for business to provide insights using historic trends and analysis to facilitate growth and drive optimal business decisions. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must have traits.
Why work at Wireless DNA?

Competitive base compensation plus lucrative Commission
Comprehensive health and dental plan
Great Employee Referral Program
Opportunities to grow and develop your career
Great culture, with a diverse and inclusive Workplace
Employee discounts across Rogers & Fido services
Parking available on site
Monthly birthday recognition, acknowledgement and celebrations
Opportunity to give back to the community through volunteering / participating in company events

Core Responsibilities
· Analyze the work and processes of Operational teams to help determine data sources and dashboard requirements.
· Creation, monitoring & support of various executive internal reports.
· Define new reports, performance benchmarks or in-house tools as required.
· Facilitate stakeholder requirement meetings.
· Data collection and management for analytics.
· Prepares / analyzes key metrics reports for the business.
· Perform data analysis for purposes of migration including extractions, mapping, cleansing and transformation.
· Creating reporting and tracking metrics to help measure the health of the business and how that trickles down to individual business units.
· Understanding the business needs of stakeholders and translate those needs into reporting deliverables
· Supporting cross-functional groups to answer strategic questions using analytics and data to help make better decisions (product, partnerships, sales, marketing, operations)
· Modelling out complex problems and understanding key business drivers to help inform strategic decisions.
· Designing and implementation of business intelligence and analytic infrastructure.
· Drive business model decisions to facilitate in business strategy and maximize profitability.
Required Competencies and Experience
· 5+ years of experience of data analytics and business modelling.
· Proficient with analytical reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, experience with Python is an added advantage.
· Experience with BI and data warehouse technologies, maintenance and extraction of data.
· Have the ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations.
· Must be an Expert Excel user with working experience of advanced excel tools (Power Query, VBA & Macros)
· Analytical skills and strong attention to detail.
· The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.
It is the policy of Wireless DNA to provide reasonable accommodations for qualified persons with disabilities who are applicants for employment. 8 hour shift

Title: Planning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Description:
Posting NumberCK52305P
Position TitlePlanning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Job ClassificationPlanner Specialist
No. of Staff Required1
Job TypeFull Time
DivisionPlanning & Development Services
DepartmentPolicy and Planning
Job Summary/Basic FunctionThe City of Kelowna is seeking a Planning Data Analyst with a specialization in GIS and data analytics. This role will conduct research and analysis of housing market trends, economic factors, growth strategy forecasting, housing affordability, and other factors influencing Kelowna’s long-range policies. We are looking for a candidate who will use innovative data science approaches and methodologies/techniques to build workflows and/or models for advanced Geo-spatial analysis. This position will analyze statistics and generates projections in support of specific aspects of planning such as land use, housing, labour force and population; identifies data trends; interprets and explains data and presents in a suitable format.
We are looking for someone who has strong experience in dealing with big data using multiple data sources and regression analysis, spatial/non-spatial econometric modeling, and GIS. Someone who understands municipal planning, data analytics and future social, environmental, and economic trends and enjoys working in a sophisticated technical environment utilizing various modeling and programming tools.
We are looking for positive team players with related experience, great communication skills and a proactive and innovative attitude. A university degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture, or other related discipline and holds professional credibility or is eligible for CIP membership with AIBC.

University Degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture or other related discipline
Professional Credibility (Eligible for CIP membership of AIBC)

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Address: 120 Bloor Street East 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 
The Business Analysis practice exists at the forefront of change, playing a crucial role in the success of technology delivery initiatives. In working as a Senior Technology Analyst , you will apply an innovative, industry recognized Business Analysis Practice Framework, which supports Iterative, and Agile approaches to technology development. You will gain exposure to various, and leading edge technologies to support key financial domains, including Retail and Business Banking, and supporting various banking products including everyday banking, lending products, and payment solutions. You will apply various techniques to support perspectives for conducting problem analysis, process analysis, scope analysis, data and rules analysis, and interface analysis as you support teams throughout the requirements management phases including: Product and Project Strategy, Requirements and Product Scoping, and Requirements and Solution Specification Definition. 

As the incumbent, you are analytical, thoughtful, thorough, and inquisitive. You enjoy evaluating and solving problems, and are methodical in your approach to understanding the root-causes that need to be addressed. You engage applied, active research techniques, and build models that help to create understanding for yourself and other stakeholders. You enjoy helping your stakeholders to realize value as they evolve their processes and solutions to a future state. 

MANDATE 
The Senior Technology Analyst acts as the requirements management project lead for medium sized projects and collaborates with the business partner to help clarify and formalize the project goals, objectives, and preliminary requirements/product scope. Further, the Senior Technology Analyst will consult with the Business and Technology SMEs to help define the need for new and/or enhanced capabilities, functionality, or optimized business processes and provide advice on the functionality, applicability, and usability of technology solutions to support business requirements. 

ACCOUNTABILITIES 

Collaborates with business partners, including senior management, to define business objectives, process and requirements 
Within the context of the project as described in ideation and feasibility phases, leads discussions with business partners to better understand the business environment, to refine potential impacts on the project scope and objectives, and to modify the requirements priority and strategy, as required 
Builds, sustains, and leverages relationships with individuals within his/her area of immediate responsibility when gathering, validating, and approving requirements to establish a comfort level in managing relationships and understanding business needs and assurance that a quality result will be delivered 
Aligns to and applies Business Analysis Best Practices to supports Iterative, and Agile approaches to technology development. Regardless of methodology, is accountable for defining approach for eliciting, analyzing, validating business and user requirements and ensure effective impact analysis is conducted with sufficient information captured from the relevant stakeholders to address the business needs, support the decomposition and prioritization of requirements and strategy 
Consults throughout the idea, feasibility and conceptualization phase and drives the delivery phase of requirements 
Supports the remaining product development life cycle and assists in scope clarifications, ensures requirements alignment to solution, maintains requirements E2E traceability and supports the prioritization and management of defects to ensure alignment to business needs and value 
Directs and coordinates requirements project staff and activities to ensure the appropriate level of coordination of work and resources 
Adheres to and ensures that others adhere to the organization’s Requirements Management Process to support the organizational governance standards and ensure quality and consistency of deliverables 
Participates in the governance and review processes to ensure compliance to standards and quality as defined by the governance framework 
Ensures all necessary stakeholders are engaged in communications between the Information Technology (IT) project team and the business to help identify who should be involved in the identification and development of the requirements 
Participates in the development of strategic and tactical IT plans to help inform future project work of the direction of the business 
Provides coaching, professional guidance, and support to Business Analysts, as required, in order to foster professional development 


KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS 
Knowledge: 

Possesses a university degree/college diploma and/or 7 to 10 years progressive business analysis/business systems experience, with a very strong usage of a broad range of business analysis techniques in a variety of project contexts, supporting medium- to large-size projects 
Demonstrates solid business knowledge of the Finance/Banking industry 
Possesses solid business understanding and knowledge of the use of technology and applications in business 
Solid knowledge of project management and system development life cycle 
Understands and is familiar with the application of techniques associated with data modeling, process modeling, and user-centred design within the context of the organizational standards 


Skills: 

Demonstrates advanced writing and documentation skills 
Possesses advanced problem-solving and analytical skills 
Displays solid interviewing and facilitation skills 
Advanced understanding and use of tools associated with the role (e.g. Visio) 
Is able to communicate with varying stakeholders in different situations (e.g., one-on-one interviews, formal requirements gathering sessions, etc.) 
Possesses solid influencing and negotiating skill 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Lead Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
Project Manager
 Qualification: Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent
    Responsibility:
 Project Planning and Setup:

 Understand project scope.


 Based on the analysis of the type of the project provide inputs on project methodology to senior stakeholders (Project Manager / Architects etc).


 Consolidate inputs from developers and collectively provide inputs on activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks etc.


 Consolidate inputs from developers and collectively provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc.


 Analyze in detail resources required for every phase, conduct estimation of time utilization of different resources and activities, prepare resource and development plan or provide inputs and review with PM.


 Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams.

 Requirement Understanding and Analysis:

 Along with the Business Analyst, gather requirements (functional and nonfunctional) from customer.


 Analyze requirements for feasibility with regards to testing and implementation.


 Provide inputs for requirements prioritization.


 Debrief team on the requirements gathered and seek feedback.


 Participate in client calls and seek clarifications if any.


 Create and maintain requirements traceability matrix along with BA.


 Provide inputs during creation of operational concepts and scenarios.


 Work with administrators to setup security requirements.

 Design:

 Understand various functional and non functional requirements and HLD in order to provide inputs to create LLD and review.


 Recommend make/ buy or alternate solutions.


 Provide inputs in designing end to end solution from a technical perspective.


 Create code development checklist.


 Prepare UI specifications / mock ups for reports / dashboards and provide guidance to team members/ designers for creating data mapping documents or unit documents for ETL & BI.


 Provide inputs to data modeling based on the project understanding.


 Walkthrough the design along with PM to the customer and coordinate to seek signoff on design and other artifacts.

 Coding:

 Guide team in coding as per design.


 Define the Development framework, reusable templates based on the organization repository and past experience.


 Allocate modules to developers for coding.


 Provide inputs for setting up development environment.


 Provide guidance to developers and set standards.


 Review pseudo codes written by developers and provide a go ahead for code development.


 Review final codes written by developers on adherence to standards/functionality and approve for testing.


 Monitor code merge to build environment and provide consolidated feedback to design.

 Testing Management:

 Provide inputs to testing strategy / approach at a high level.


 Review test cases written by team.


 In case of small projects, review/ guide for SIT and other testing.


 Provide support for development of unit/ integration test cases as required.


 Check if peer review is completed at each step of test execution.


 Monitor defects raised and closed.


 Conduct root cause analysis to avoid repetition of defects.


 Follow up with team assigned for rework on code defects and close the same.


 Attend QA audits as and when required.

 Deployment:

 Setup instructions.


 Understand release and deployment environment and provide inputs for release/deployments plan.


 Resolve issues that arise during project deployment/ closure.


 Check that all action items mentioned in the deployment checklist have been completed.


 Monitor and review smoke testing, mock runs.

 Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities):

 Provide status inputs to the project manager.


 Support Project Manager in creating a weekly status report including tasks achieved in the week and plan for next week.


 Provide guidance to team through SDLC.


 Track metrics wrt plan and monitor the same.


 Collect and present metrics (utilization, time spent on each activity / team etc) to the Project Manager.


 In case of change in the project, support in creating a first level impact analysis.


 Support project manager in gathering all documents required for audits and maintain them regularly.

 Service Support and Maintenance:

 Create transition plan.


 provide transition walkthrough to the maintenance team.

 Stakeholder Management:

 Understand internal stakeholders (Account Manager, Project Managers etc) and client expectations.


 Follow through on commitments, achieve timely resolution of issues.

 Knowledge Management:

 Provide guidance to team members to maintain all documentation related to project.


 Create/ guide creation of knowledge articles on the problem, workaround solutions, best practices, new methodology implemented, retrospection report etc.


 Monitor and report the usage of knowledge articles.

 People Management:

 Provide assistance in selection of representative employee groups for training.


 Conduct training or knowledge sharing sessions.


 Mentor team members in project teams with respect to product and domain skills on projects.


 Conduct technical, face to face interviews.


 Conduct / support managers in conducting appraisals for team members and share final ratings with the relevant stakeholders.


 Coordinate with the project/program manager in understanding how the employee can better contribute to the project, seek feedback and address concerns.

 Sales Support:

 Understand RFP.


 Participate in ongoing calls with the vertical team members.


 Provide references.


 Create relevant parts of the proposal and identify the case studies to be included.


 Provide time and resource estimates based on technical complexity and type of work done earlier.


 List out the challenges, dependencies, assumptions and timelines required for the project under guidance.


 Provide inputs on technology preference based on the project requirements.


 Review with the applicable vertical teams and incorporate their feedback.


 Must Have Skills 

Tableau

 Good To Have Skills 

SQL

 Employee Status : Full Time Employee
 Shift : Day Job
 Travel : No
 Job Posting : Jun 27 2022

 Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.
